review_content: 330ml bottle. Poured a hazy medium to light amber with a short-lived frothy white head. The aroma is grainy malt, big yeast, banana, some citrus notes. The flavour is moderate to light sweet, with a yeasty, slightly acidic, fruity, light dry spicy palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Cloudy pale yellow.  Taste is a little creamy and sweet with a crisp, slightly bitter finish.

풍미자체는 무난무난한 에일이며 오바마 맥주로 유명합니다.

이름이 구스아일랜드312인 이유는 시카고 지역번호가 312이기 때문이고 3월 12일을 구스데이로 정하고 있지요.

한국에선 강남 구스 브루어리에 가시면 신선한 크래프트 맥주는 물론 빈티지 맥주까지 드실 수 있습니다. 분위기는 아주 좋은 편.

02/04/21 - Bottle whilst watching the football. Poured prior to kick off with a high amount of carbonation. Aroma of wheat, straw and citrus. By the time Ipswich had scored 2 goals in first 14 minutes the carbonation calmed down and the beer got better. Taste of wheat, citrus and a hint of banana. Quite watery. Enjoyed it, but this was helped by the football result for a change.

Lockdown March 2021. Small brown bottle, no sediment, from a BeerHawk UK box. Gentle flavours. Lagerish, but drinkable. It's OK. [2.6]

Feb 2020. Can from a Beer Hawk cheap deal. It hasn't been a great deal, and meh stuff like this has mostly been what it's been about. This is beer for people who don't actually like beer.  [2.4]

July 2019 355ml brown bottle, no residue, part of a Goose Flight Park bought at Lidl. Lacks depth and body and flavour.  Meh. [2.4] 

Oct 2016  355ml brown bottle, unfiltered (though with no sediment) from local Co-Op. This is a pleasant wheat beer, though it has a watery texture. There’s a modest spice, and a gentle Cascade fragrance. It’s quite dry and lager like. I would have preferred more body, more sweetness, and more overall character. The hops were OK for me, adding a light tropical note to what is intended to be a refreshing drink. Yeah, I could drink this again. [2.9]
Aroma 7. Appearance 3. Taste 5. Palate 2. Overall 12. Wheat, sweet citrus fruit, and yeast aroma. High carbonation. Malt and wheat taste, some spices, honey, citrus fruit, and a hint of yeast.

Old rating from 12-05-16 - 355ml bottle, a gift from a friend who visited Vegas. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a small white head. Aromas of yeast & wheat and faintly of apples & honey. Tastes of apples, honey, grains, bread & wheat. Aftertaste is a very mild wheat bitter finish.

Aroma agradable a cítrico y cereal, color amarillo claro, bastante transparente, sin cuerpo, acuoso, y la espuma desaparece en pocos segundos. Parece pis.
En boca, muy gaseosa, pero sorprendentemente envolvente. Bastantes matices positivos que la convierten en una cerveza que, a la hora de la cata, va de menos a más. No tiene demasiado sabor a trigo, como el nombre dice, pero es bastante decente en global.

Old note, for counting purpose :

Bottle of 355ml, rinked in a Tulip glass, from the fridge.

 Gold coloured beer, wheaty aroma and taste.

Need to try it again.

355ml can. Hazy gold, small white head, little retention. Aroma is wheaty, floral, sweetness. Taste is a little thin, but getting wheat, some yeast, light citrus. High carbonation. It's a bit disappointing.
Blond légèrement trouble. Peu de mousse. Arômes : agrume, citron, floral, froment, légère amertume. Recette étonnante et équilibrée.

35,5cl Can @ Saveur-Biere, Fretin, France.
Golden colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, hints of wheat and citrus.
Taste is malt, sweet, wheat, citrus, slightly yeasty.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Bière 33 cl achetée chez Saveur Bière, bue pendant un week-end à center parcs. Robe blonde pale, limpide, fine mousse blanche de moyenne tenue. Nez léger, malté, très  légèrement citronné. Bouche aux saveurs légères de malt, une pointe d'acidité, corps léger, bière de soif, peu complexe et fade. Rien de bien extraordinaire. (M)
Bière achetée dans une box de Saveur Bière. Que dire à part que c'est une bière insipide et sans intérêt ?
Flesje gedronken bij EenJ. Goudgeel troebel bier met weinig schuim. Aroma is moutig. Smaak is moutig en ietsje fruitig. Nasmaak is iets kruidig.
bottle to glass; surprised this was a new rate for me.  light yellow.  straw aroma.  a little soapy actually.  seems a little all over the place.  not a refreshing brew so...pass on this one.
Can. Banana aroma. Light bitter taste. Weizen flavor. Well carbonated and creamy.

Foamy white head. Golden colour. Aroma is malty with bread and biscuits and light fruity (plumes). Flavor is malty too with bread and light fruity (plumes) notes, ending in a malty finish. Light bodied.
Bright and a bit of citrus on the nose.  Minimal haziness on the pour for a wheat.  Taste is like the nose.  Bright, slight hops but hardly bitter.  Clean and smooth.  Not bad.
Minimal straw body with a bit of cereal within and slightly grassy finish that is dry.

Can. Clear golden-yellow with white head. Sweetish aroma with notes of wheat, candy, some spiciness, honey, ripe fruits. The flavor is sweet and mild bitter with notes of candy, toffee, wheat, yeasts, citrus, some spiciness. Medium-bodied.
Can. Hazy yellow, bubbly head. Floral, soapy aromas. Light sweetness with low bitterness, vegetal, floral, quite bland. Medium bodied, watery.
Summer of 2005 trip to Chicago every bar I stopped in seemed to have 312 on draft. 15 years later finally tried it via a mixed 15 pack.  Standard wheat beer, hazy, light bodied, touch of lemon.

Si me gustó, el sabor está muy rico, no está amarga. Es ligera, 
Para las cervezas de trigo esta bien,
Ale liviana y refrescante, para nada amarga cosa que me agrada bastante en cuanto a sabor pero muy plana, un poco aguada en comparación con otras pero cumplidora
Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin white head. There was a grassy aroma and the taste was kind of spicy with some malty notes. A nice wheat ale that I would drink again.

Thin tight white head stayed on an overly carbonated pale golden body.
Pale malt & cereal aroma.
Medium bodied, tingly in the tongue with a cloying back.
Pale malt, sugar, wheat, syrup & generally artificial tastes.
Pants.
Une petite bière surprenante avec un goût appréciable. Une bien belle découverte.

Poured hazy with a short-lasting head. Little aroma, taste bland with hints of lemon & coriander. For a minute I thought I'd poured one of the alcohol free beers I've been drinking lately; not much to choose between them.
Straw golden yellow bit hazy not much though thin soapy head smell of spice wheat light light fruit no hops taste is crisp smooth hoppy fruity not to much..bitter on the finish nice beer
Bottle from Waitrose in a mixed box. Not usually a fan of wheat beers - but this one was pretty good. Lots of flavour without the usual accompanying bitterness.

18.02.20, kran w Frankies & Bennys 
Aromat przyjemny, chmielowy, owoce tropikalne, lekki. Smak slodowo-cytrusowy, zbożowa nuta pszeniczna. Goryczka niska, acz wyczuwalna. Nasycenie średnie w kierunku wysokiego.

Pours headless, malty aroma and grassy spiced fruit finish. Have seen this in a mix pack with midway and other goose island beers, I like their other stuff but this would be a reason for me not to buy the selection pack, it’s very different and far from hoppy like Midway and their ipa.
Bottle @ pop, Ängelholm. Pours a light golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and malty with notes of hops and herbs. Dry finish.
Sweet cereal and prominent malt. Minimal bitterness. Thin bodied. A bit too sweet for me.
330 ml bottle at Murakami Japanese restaurant Kiev. Unclear golden, no head. Vanilla, corn, citrus. Dry fruity bitterness. Light bodied, watery texture, lively carbonated, dry finish. Okay somehow.

Aroma is grainy and lemon.
Flavour is lemon with hops and grains. Some corn.
Leaves sourish lemon aftertaste.
So-so, their IPA is much better
Good tasting beer that is good for a BBQ. Love the aroma with the smooth finish. Solid pour with good head. Flavor is refreshing and different for a wheat beer

tried this when it came out and still dont like it. aroma is cream of wheat, paper, yeast, faint pinesol and wood. flavor is steamed stale wheat, wet cardboard, and cheap yeast and mild earthy grassiness. palate is smooth and creamy. love hefeweizen, do not like this stuff -- if i want a lighter refreshing grainy beer, i would go for a good regional AAL. not my thing, leave it at that...

Botella de 35,5 cl. Fecha de consumo 01/2020. Color amarillo velado sin casi espuma, carbonatación escasa. Aroma a naranja, limón, cereal. Sabor también a cítricos y cereal, cuerpo bajo, textura acuosa, nada destacable, bastante floja en general.

zapach przyjemny, choć niespecjalnie intensywny, trochę cytrusów, trochę drożdży, odrobina mąki i białych owoców. kolor złoty, mocno opalizujący, piana dość skąpa i niespecjalnie trwała. biała. w smaku intensywne, pełne, ale nie słodkie, bardzo dużo cytrusów, białe owoce, trochę żywic i odrobina sosny, wszystko ze sporą ilością drożdży i odrobiną świeżego drewna. goryczka umiarkowana, cytrusowa, sosnowa. nasycenie umiarkowane

Une blanche avec un peu de corps... arôme de mandarine, levures très présentes. Ok.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is a highly drinkable wheat beer type. It certainly shows how far US craft brewing has come. This beer is very subtly good.

En copa, cerveza pajiza bastante túrbia, con una generosa capa de espuma blanca. Aroma muy pobre, encontrando cereales, caramelo, paja, grano, algo de fruta como melocotón y alguna especia. En boca, textura ligera y acuosa, de carbonatación media/alta y amargor casi inexistente. Sabor ligeramente ácido y con cierta astringencia, cereal blanco, caramelo, fruta de hueso madura, especias, grano y poco más. Una Wheat Ale muy floja. Me esperaba más de Goose Island.
Bottle. Slightly hazy, amber golden color, small head. Light citrus and malt aroma. Dry taste, medium bitterness. Floral, citrus hop aftertaste. Medium carbonation, full body.
Can drunk at home. Hazy golden appearance. Aroma is wheat, citrus and malt. Flavour is wheat, malt, hops, dry and bitter.

Color naranja claro, con leve neblina, translúcida. Espuma blanca de un dedo de espesor y escasa retención. Aroma a cereal, floral, ligero plátano que desaparece al poco rato, entonces aparece una sensación desagradable, agria, como de sudor. Sabor a cereal, ligero cítrico, naranja dulce y piel de limón, muy escaso amargor final, alcohol bien integrado. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación media al comienzo, a los pocos minutos se queda casi en nula.

330ml can. Slightly cloudy pale amber colour with white head when poured. Very slight citrus aroma,. Strong wheat flavour, but very little depth and almost no other notes. Medium carbonation. Very easy drinking.

33 cl. bottle @ home, served in a teku glass, due date: 2019/07/29.

Aroma: not very intense aromas of lime, lime zest, citrus, grains. Hints of flowers.

Appearance: gold to dark yellow color with perfectly white head made of small bubbles. Low to medium head thickness with low retention and no Brussels' lacing. Low to medium haziness.

Taste: low sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Not very intense flavors of lime, citrus, citrus zest, salt, grains, hints of unfermented grains, hay. Some very light floral overtones. Quite well balanced overall.

Mouthfeel: low to medium body, watery texture, medium carbonation, not very long dry finish with low bitterness and the same previously mentioned flavors. Alcohol is very well hidden by the sourness and the saltiness and only very slightly noticeable because of some light throat and mouth warming. Astringency is not noticeable.

Overall: very good looking, not very intense aromas and flavors of lime, citrus, citrus zest, grains, unfermented grains, salt. It lacks complexity and layers of flavors, the zesty and lime flavors overpower all the other flavors. It is too watery and I think it would be better with a less watery texture and more flavors from the malts. It is very refreshing at least.

Color: Straw color, cloudy, foam settles quickly.
Aroma: Hoppy, fruity, Lemon is clearly visible.
Taste. Pleasant body, slightly malt on the palate, and zest tartness. aftertaste hop bitterness.
Bottom line: Light wheat ale, perfect for hot weather,
Botella 330ml Color dorada,opaca con blanca espuma,fina,escasa,poco resistente.Aroma citrico,frutal,especias.Sabor citrico,frutal,especias,acuosa,poco cuerpo
Starts promising but with a undesirable finish, like a seafood buffet where the oysters have gone bad.

olff-clear bright yellow with white head. aroma is watermelon. taste is dry, bitter full of obvious af c-hops, fair amount of water. 

i don't like it. tastes like a product.

Can. Hazy golden body, medium white head with good retention and plenty of lacing. Aroma of wheat, orange peel, caramel and bubble gum.  Taste of grains, coriander, caramel and citrus. Light and a tad too sweet. Ok-ish.

I in my 61 years of walking this earth, I have tried many good, high end, beers... I used to be in a group that belonged to an import beer of the week, try it club years ago... And I was pleasantly surprised by this beer, coming from a can, in a Pizza Place..... I loved the taste, and I loved that it had no harsh after taste... I also loved that it DID NOT make me congested, or have stuffy sinuses like most things with wheat in them.... I also did not get the day after beer, short temper with this one... Kudos to the brewers, I think you are on to something here.... I will definitely try this one again... I think it has shot to the top of my list.... I will be looking for this one....
Ljusgul med obefintligt skum. Doftar lite malt, hö och halm. Smaken fyllig, lite maltig. Eftersmaken tämligen kort, ytterst lite beska och sötma.

Bevuta in bottiglia da 33. Arona  vagamente floreale. Oro torbido con schiuma poco persistente. 
Cefgpr
Hazy wheat beer, wheaty with a little lemon aftertaste. Ok but I don't think wheat beers are for me
Bottle of 33cl. Big white head. Fruity, mild, wheat. Light bitterness, dry finish

from backlog, Bottle, pale hazy golden with a thinner sized white head. Notes are artificial wheat and fruit citrus, caramel, spice, and coriander. Too sweet and weird overall. Light to medium mouthfeel.
Bue avec Laura. Nez un peu citroné. Bouche ronde typé bière de blé. Rien de fou mais sympa quand même.

Déçue par cette bière qui est plus acide qu'aromatique ce qui est dommage pour une bière dont le marketing est basé sur le houblon.
La meilleure façon de boire cette bière c'est a 35C et bien fraîche. Du coup la recherche du plaisir est limité.
Not wheat-like at all. More of just a safe blonde ale with presumably some wheat. rogers centre toronto
355ml bottle. Yellow, hazy. Small head that was gone in a few seconds. Fruit aroma, feel a bit hops, slightly sweet.
355 ml bottle. Golden coloured liquid, cloudy with a small white head. Aroma is grain, lemons, bread. Taste is watery, citrus, faint spiciness.

Unclear, yellow-golden colored, small+ white head. Some malty and wheat notes, medium sweet, light spicy, bit bready, light bitterness, some light citric hops, dry finish. Medium- bodied, average carbonation, bit watery.

12 oz bottle with a 23 July 2019 BB date stamp.
Pours with a pale amber body and a semi-durable white head.
Aroma: Very mild. Wheat, yeasty and hops.
Flavor: follows the aroma and has low strength. Mild bitterness. Wheat notes throughout.

Cerveza rubia, suave, que dice tener notas de limón que son difíciles de percibir.
Color suave y con buen nivel de espuma

33cl bottle. Hazy golden colour, medium sized white head.
Grains, lemon, bread, a bit watery.
Medium carbonation, low bitterness.
Comme les autres produits de ce 4-pack mixte, c'est plutôt de base dans tout, mais c'est agréable à déguster ;-)

I may be a little generous on flavor and overall here, but could be slightly above average for the style.   Semi-clear yellowish appearance with a clean/crisp feel.  I actually thought it was filtered.  On the thin side, like all 3 of the Goose Island beers that I've sampled.  Tasty and refreshing....just not feeling their standard beers that much.

Low formation foam, medium/low density and short duration. Golden coloured liquid, cloudy but not as much as the others of the same style. 
Aroma is refreshing and light. Bring notes of lemon and citric stuff (came from hops that were used) but in a light way, something of wheat and yeast. I also felt a background of white bread.
On mouth, very light and much complexity, but pleasant. Easy to note that it is a wheat beer because of its bulky characteristics on mouth. Little bit of yeast taste and a very low bitterness at the end that completes the style’s expectations.
The aftertaste brings a little bit higher bitterness that asks for another sip.
I expected more of this beer, but at all its a correct beer and a good one. Honours the name of Goose.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Low formation foam, medium/low density and short duration. Golden coloured liquid, cloudy but not as much as the others of the same style. 
Aroma is refreshing and light. Bring notes of lemon and citric stuff (came from hops that were used) but in a light way, something of wheat and yeast. I also felt a background of white bread.
On mouth, very light and much complexity, but pleasant. Easy to note that it is a wheat beer because of its bulky characteristics on mouth. Little bit of yeast taste and a very low bitterness at the end that completes the style’s expectations.
The aftertaste brings a little bit higher bitterness that asks for another sip.
I expected more of this beer, but at all its a correct beer and a good one. Honours the name of Goose.
355ml bottle. Pours hazy hold with a small white head. Aroma is grain, lemons, bread. Taste is watery, citrus, faint spiceness. Bland and boring.

Pours foggy gold. Moderate white fluffy head. Nose: cereals, wort, apricot, fruity hop. Light-bodied. Taste: sweetish, clean, malty, bready, lightly hoppy. Light bitterness. Hoppy ending. Still lacking that proper hop bite of common craft ales.

Żółte piwko od gąski. Kolor żółty, zamglony. Piany niewiele a to co było znikło w kilka sekund nie pozostawiając właściwie nic.
Aromaty: cytryna, brzoskwinia, mango, przejrzałe owoce, jasny miód.
Smak i odczucia: spory zawód muszę powiedzieć bo piwo jest dość puste, wodniste, nasycone dość wysoko i to przeszkadza. Czuć odrobinę chmiel, troszkę kwasowości, lekko słodkie.
Bottle 33. Aspect : blonde pétillante à fines bulles disparaissant rapidement. Nez : malt, un peu le citron. Bouche : malt cara, blé, légèrement citronnée, plate, fraîche ...sans plus.
Pours clear amber with a thin white head. Extremely carbonated. Aroma of lemons. Taste is lightly malty, fruit notes. Lemon and citrus on the palate, coriander buzz on the nose.
Bottle. Pours hazy light gold with white head that dissipates quickly. Lemon citrus and light bread aroma. Light malt with lemon note. Light, somewhat watery body. Short finish.

Bottled 0,355L. Pale yellow color, light bubbly aspect with light and bit escaping white head. Fresh and smooth mouthfeel, light carbonation with watery body and notes of wheat, light hop, herb and sweet/bitter final. Light alcoholic perception, watery texture.

Аромат очень крутой хоть и не яркий. Сочные нотки груши и сладкие нотки ванили, прямо как колокольчик. Цвет желтый, хорошо мутный, пенка легкая, белая. Да, вкус уже похуже, все равно еще ощущаются легкие нотки груши и что ли манго, но совсем легкие. Послевкусие совсем легкие нотки хмеля, но конечно не хватает или хмеля или немного пшеницы. Легкие нотки какого то неплохого минерального состава. Карбонизация к слову тоже вполне сильная. В целом конечно водянисто, но чем то грушевая нотка меня зацепила.
Una cerveza suave, pero de un sabor interesante, ideal para tardes calurosas y para gente que le gustan las cervezas rubias de bajo grado alcoholico
Color is bright yellow, almost no foam. Aroma is wheat and bread. Taste is common for light wheat beer. A little bit watery, but acceptable.
Jaune dorée, aucune mousse. Nez malté céréales doux. Gout pareil, un peu bubblegum et citronné puis note blé sucré. Corps leger, aucune carbonation. Fin un peu douce

355 can. Pours golden. The aroma is next to non. This literally smells and tastes like a macro lager. I remember trying this years ago when I first got into craft beer and I thought it was decent, it’s either completely changed or my palette has. Super disappointed.
355ml can. Cloudy gold colour with small white head. Sweet wheaty, watery lemon, sweet malt, white bread, watery citrus, light watery soapy. Too watery, otherwise fairly decent.
Carbonated water with a slight bitter lemon taste. Golden with a very very slight cloudiness. Incredibly disappointing. Glad when I finished it.
473ml can. Fresh lemon and wheat aroma. Pours with a cloudy light golden hue and frothy white head. Mild bitter lemon flavour with some grassy notes. Thin to medium body. Fairly plain finish.
A urban wheat ale with hints of lemon. Drank from the bottle so don't know colour.  A weak
Can. Innocuous but also mostly flavorless. Very subdued hop flavor, with very mild bitter finish. At least it has no off-flavors. Defines the word Meh.
Picked at a Beerstore, went with the name, as Goose Island can do good beers, but not all of them are of the same quality I guess. Disappointing.
No wheat taste, tasted like carbonated water. One of the worst beers I've ever tasted.
Drank from can at Northern Kentucky convention center. Better than the other macro kagers available. Sweeter malt, light hef yeast flavors.

Appearance Hazy yellow, good frothy head 

Aroma Mild banana, plenty clove, bit of lemon 

Taste Sweet, mildly bitter 

Palate Medium body, medium-high carbonation
Clear blond body.  Off-White Head.  Lightly citric nose.  Moderately bitter flavour. Lightly weak.

Pours dark yellow with minimal white head that sticks around. Low to medium body with average carbonation. Low bitter after taste. Almost creamy texture. Long lingering after taste but pleasant. Earthy what taste to it.
355ml can. Golden colour, moderate head, not much aroma. Pleasant undemanding taste with nothing that really stands out. Decent missle of the road example of the style.

Purchased a 24-ounce Canton from my local liquor store. Thin white head on top of a hazy yellow body. I believe what I'm smelling is the yeast in the beer I don't smell any hops nor the sweetness from The Malt. My first impression is that it's bland but that's compared to the double IPA I drink before. It's actually smooth and fruity. It's clean on pellet no aftertaste. For now I still use it as my Baseline for all wheat ales in the future.

Ligera y fresca. Ideal para acompañar alimentos pesados y muy condimentados.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 35,5cl DLUO dans un mois

Mousse : Quelques bulles éparses

Couleur : Blonde citron légèrement brumeuse

Nez : Presque neutre, léger blé, on devine une note citronnée.

Bouche : Attaque fraîche, presque neutre à peine acidulée et note citronnée. Malt céréale / biscuit avec touche épicée et soupçon houblonné, texture très aqueuse. Finition sur le blé, faible amertume, pas de longueur.

Avis : Fraîche elle a le niveau d’une eau gazeuse aromatisée citronnelle, soit très rafraîchissante mais avec très peu de gout. En réchauffant elle offre une bouche malt / houblon / épice assez jolie. Mais le nez reste très plat.
Cerveja de trigo com baixo amargor, aroma do lúpulo Cascade e um sabor frutado. Seu corpo é suave, cremoso, e muito refrescante.
Thuis uit een flesje. Bleke gele kleur, een beetje vlakke smaak! Niet bijzonder.

Recommended. I do like this beer. Light golden color with a hazy cloudy look. Foam is easily created when pulling into the cup. Then is the lemon juice aroma mixed with hops. Lighter than the smell of IPA one but still you can catch it. The sour of wheat beer is hardly tasted meanwhile you could find the lemon taste after swallowing. The bitter is just enough to taste it while not like that hard in the IPA.
Not surprising nor balanced. Taste of wheat is not strong in this one, but color and aroma is good.
33 cl bottle at travel lodge walthamstow. Pours hazy with light yellow color.  Light wheaty aroma, with wheaty taste. Njaee
Pajiza clara, aroma escaso, levadura y notas cítricas. En boca gas abundante, ligera de cuerpo. Seca, especiada y cítrica.

Wheat ale de 4,2 % abv et 18 ebu ... ça vole bas, et comme il s'agit
d'une " urban ale ", c'est dangereux de voler bas en ville ..
Couleur dorée, à la clarté brillante.
Bulles moyennes, en colonnes droites, vives.
Mousse blanche, peu formée, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de jus de pomme, raisin de table.
1ère bouche fluide sur un jus de fruits un rien houblonné ..
(mais alors un rien s'il vous plaît, et avec quelques glaçons !!!).
2ème qui diminue d'un quart de pouce la bouche précédente.
Arrière-bouche qui ferait peur aux mouches qui volent trop bas.
3ème qui commence à raser les pâquerettes.
Arrière-bouche qui va cueillir parfois une pousse de citronnelle.
Longueur qui s'en prend à la pelouse et commence à tondre très bas.
Jambes à flocons moyens, longues.
Levure basique de chez basique.
Alcool inutile et non concerné par le sujet, il est parti voir les vitrines
en ville .. puisqu'il s'agit d'une urban ale ..
Finale qui se plante dans la pelouse (elle volait trop bas …).
CONCLUSION : je plains les oies qui volent à cette altitude de 312 mm !
La seule issue pour elle est de se planter, selon le schéma 1/2/1/1/2 ...
Tap at giordanos in Westerville. Light tan pour and seems watery. Nose is weak wheat and cereal and lemon. Body is wimpy and light. Not a great wheat brew. Keep looking.
Leve, não é saborosa mas da pra beber uma tarde toda sem enjoar. Boa, o limão ta mais só para aroma mesmo rsrs
Not getting anything that screams wheat ale. Just a lightly hopped mass produced  IPA wannabe - Urban Wuss might be more accurate! Refreshing, but it’s not a wheat ale.

Bottle. Bought May 2018; Drank May 2018 - Hazy pale yellowy gold in colour. Small white head. Malty; wheaty malts, grainy. Yeasty and lightly spicy. Fruity; orange and lemon citrus. Hoppy; light hop bitterness. Sweet wheaty malty yeasty light citrus and spice. Fairly dry. Easy drinking and refreshing. OK. (2018-05)
Pours lightly hazy golden. Aroma is light bread and hops. Taste is light corn syrup, moving to lemon zest and a hint of hops. Finish is lightly bitter. Not my favorite wheat ale.
Can poured into a glass. Aroma has a slight citrus influence but mostly has a bready smell. Taste is watery with slight orange aftertaste. Good beer on a warm day

Bottle from coop ayr a hazy golden beer with wheat and malt aroma flavour is lemon some wheat lager malt backbone slight hoppy but not too bitter

风格：American Wheat Beer
酒精度：4.2%vol
原麦汁浓度：10.27°P
灌装日期：2016.08.25

饮用日期：2017.06.14
饮用温度：4℃-9℃

外观：略有些浑浊、气泡不断产生上升的深赤金色；泡沫显得稀疏得很。

香气：中等稍偏下的有些倾向焦糖的麦芽味，一些脂香。

味道：入口清甜的谷物气息与酯香混合；酒花苦味中等偏下、比较直接，持续尚可。温度越低越偏向酒花苦味，9℃时较平衡。

口感：入口较顺滑，一些奶油感，一些辛辣感。低温时较干爽，辛辣感更突出。

总体印象：一款畅饮酒，在适当的温度突出麦芽、酯香与酒花苦味的平衡和清爽略辛辣的口感，但是风味不复杂，的确显得有些平淡。

建议饮用温度7℃-10℃

Not a bad beer, but just slightly plain. Grainy, peppery aroma with hints of lemon. Taste is slightly peppery, faint yeast, lemon and grain. Light body, high carbonation.

Found on an Easter Island supermarket. Imported by Cerveceria Chile. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white fizzy head. Aroma is pretty dull, a touch fruity with hints of orange and lemon. Some cereal traces with evident use of wheat. Taste is almost as watered down as the aroma, but with little notes of bread, orange and melon. Cereally and bready notes predominate. Watery texture, simple, soft and straight forward beverage. Not interested really. I can find regular lagers more enjoyable to drink than this one.
My favorite beer in the whole world from my favorite brewery. So many layers of flavor. So so good. My only perfect score rated beer.

On tap at John’s Restaurant & Tavern in Winfield, IL. to accompany the food. Dispensed to a shaker displaying a hazed, orangey/gold color, with a presentable layer of soft white froth that was rather persistent, and foamy dots & dashes of lacing. The nose was soft wheat, a bit of grassiness, light citrus as lemon & grapefruit, and subtle, honey-like sweetness. Ditto on the flavor, light bodied, with lively carbonation, and a low, earthy hop bitterness. Didn’t expect much, but quite sessionable at 4.2%, nicely food compatible, and would work well as a yard work hydrator.

355ml can from Waitrose. Nice artwork. Pours a hazy yellow/orange with disappearing white head. Nose is bready/biscuit malt with tiny banana aroma. Get some melon and honey too. Light smooth mouth feel. Taste is malty with hints of melon and lemon. Dry slightly bitter finish. Not bad for a session alternative to lager.

I’m a massive fan of this. Juicy an vibrant and easy going: slightly creamy and hazy in the mouth, bit of lemon in the aroma and the taste. Easily available. Love it when I’m in Chicago, love that I can also get it at the Morrison’s in East Kilbride.

Can from Waitrose, West Byfleet. Citrus aroma. A slightly hazy gold. The bright white head dissipates quickly. Light/medium sour with a sweet undertow. Lemon. Cloves. Yeasty. Light bodied. Slick. Kinda chalky residue. Long dry finish. Had it previously and was unimpressed, but found it more refreshing from a can. However it’s somewhat muted. A bit too light weight. Not urban, that should be heavy, surely. Won’t can complain about the price, 20% as it’s a new line.

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a cloudy orange color forming a small white head with minimum retention and no lacings left. Nose is sweet. Notes of caramel and wheat. Flowery hops. In overall, a sweet and mild taste. Lots of malts. Light body and carbonation. Good drinkability.

Ehh, I mean it has some redeeming qualities to it. The grain profile on the front and the finish are fun and what makes a wheat beer interesting. That being said, there isn’t really anything else going on and that’s all you can smell and it’s kind of an ugly looking beer.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of lemon, herbs, slight banana, a little grain and subtle honey.

Bottle from Tesco. Golden colour without the cloudiness of a wheat beer, but with a thin white head. Aroma banana and fruity. Taste mainly sweet, with a light sour finish.

Bottle at home. Xmas gift pack. 
Amber pour with white head. Malty zest aroma. Malty wheat Grapefruit hints. Bit average really.

Aromat: w pierwszej chwili z butelki wyraźne cytrusy, a dokładnie cytryna/limonka, lekki banan. Po chwili jednak wrażenie zdecydowanie osłabło.
Wygląd: Nalały się jakieś paprochy, nie był to osad drożdżowy, podejrzewam, że mogło się wytrącić białko. Piana bardzo nietrwała, raczej gruboziarnista, po chwili opada do zera.
Smak: Jakieś lekkie banany, bardzo delikatne cytrusy. 
Podsumowanie: Piwo nic mi nie urwało, drugie podejście do Goose Island i drugie mocno przeciętne.

Growler from the Summerhill LCBO. Pours a slightly cloudy golden orange colour with modest white head. Aroma is wheat, sweet fruitiness and a light grassiness. Flavour is big chewy wheat, a little tree fruit and light grassiness. Body on the lighter side. Straightforward but pleasant.

Bottle as gift. Pours hazy yellowy-gold with a thin white head. Aromas of dusty grain, lemony hop and a sickly pale malt. Tastes add a slight orangeade sherbetiness and a countering gentle hop bitterness. It has a sharp, light body with an oily mouthfeel. It has a nice body and overall it is sharp and refreshing but for me it has a slightly sickly finish that keeps interrupting the enjoyment.
Slightly hazy dark yellow. Aroma vaguely apple, grass, turpentine. Taste is slightly sweet, wheaty, lemony hops. I tend to prefer my wheat beers more European style than this.

Bottle, 355mL. Pours clear yellow to pale amber, frothy head that diminishes rapidly. Smells of moderate malt, quite lager-ish but with a fruity note, like persimmon fruit for those of you who know about it. It’s subtle but it’s there. Creamier than a lager, showing more weissbier character, nothing too outstanding but can’t complain about the texture: smooth and refreshing (midwinter, I know). Does not develop though, ver static and one dimensional. Better than some lagers but not out of the league of the better lager, if that makes sense. There’s nothing wrong with it, there just is nothing amazing either. They played safe with this brew and it tastes just like that. Moving the balance more towards hops or towards wheat would have made a better beer.

Appearance: hazy golden with slight head. Effervescent 
Aroma: floral, zesty, grass, slight biscuit 
Mouthfeel: medium lught mouthfeel and carbonation

Bread and yeast aromas. Pours a cloudy gold bubbly yellow with a thin white head. Some sweetness with bread and apricots flavor. Microscopic hops sour in the finish. Interesting but not my favorite style.

It pours well, not too heady. Deeo cloudy wheatbeer look. Smells very wheaty (you could be on a late summer walk after the feilds have been ploughed. Very nice.

Gentle flavour, it is watery, but I would prefer to say mellow. Its not got the same acrid aftertaste as some wheat beers. It doesnt send your pallet screaming between sips. It kind of sits there and throws hints of wheat and honey at you. You know the really light clear honey that you might eat on toast. Its like honey on toast.

Honestly this is so easy to drink, that if you are partial to a wheat beer (which im usually not) you will want another one, and you will mellow out in your feild, layed back, looking at the shapes in the clouds.

Cheers

Clear golden yellow colour with a small ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; Three-quarter finger head and white foam which last for 1 minute; Fair sticky lacing with active carbonation; Fragrant aroma of light Ale malt, with strong apricots, strong plums, dark fruits, banana, strong floral, sugar, light biscuits and light grass; Light sweet taste of light Ale malt, with fairly strong wheat, faint tartness, floral, hint of molasses, light spice, bread, light lemon, light bitter hops and light grass; Mid to light body. Quite crisp and slick palate; Mouth Feel is light Ale maltyness in a slick background. Very simple wheaty taste with little tartness. Flowery with almost no sweetness. Light bread and yeasty with light lemon to round. Pretty neat… Hoppiness is strong apricots, strong plums, dark fruits, strong floral and light grass in nose. Floral, light spice, light lemon and light grass in taste; Bitterness is low for an abrupt, low astringent bitter wheaty finish;
Quite dry after taste. Smooth and light bitter to mouth.



Comments: This one has some very strong sweet fruity hops aroma, quite unusual for an Wheat Ale, but taste-wise it’s rather pedestrian, just weaty and low-blow floral hops without much surprise. Drinkable but special, if only the nice aroma can carry onto the taste!

12 oz bottle. Poured a clear straw yellow with little head. Aroma was almost non-existent with mild fruit notes. Flavor was peach, straw, and wheat. Light body, thin texture, bubbly carbonation, smooth finish.

A 12 fl oz bottle with a best before date of 26th July 2017, poured into a Spiegelau American wheat beer glass. It poured a hazy golden straw yellow colour with a one finger white head that dissipated quite quickly and left pretty much no lacing. Aromas of sweet malt, grainy, cereal and a touch of lemon. Tastes bready, light sweet apple, corn, grain and lemon. Crisp, light bodied with moderate to high carbonation. Overall, I understand when people say that it’s a refreshing summer beer, but even so, there’s nothing interesting in its aroma or taste. Unfortunately, this one is not for me.

De Goose Island Brewing(USA) propiedad actualmente de AB in Bev(BEL) la popular “312 Urban Wheat Ale” una cerveza estilo American Wheat Ale de 4.2% ABV, ya e reseñado cervezas de este estilo y básicamente es la interpretación americana de una cerveza de trigo, como la tradición marca American es igual a balance hacia los lúpulos de aromas frútales, muy interesante y en lo personal me agrada la combinación de las maltas de trigo y los lúpulos tan diversos que se pueden emplear.
En apariencia es una cerveza con una corona de espuma delgada para una de trigo, pues una de las principales características de estas maltas es que dotan de mucha espuma y buena retención, tiene tambien una retención escasa, color amarillo-pajizo con significativa turbiedad, actividad de carbonatación mínima, cuerpo ligero en las paredes del vaso.
El aroma es muy ligero y no se aprecia el lúpulo como debería en un estilo americano, se puede llegar a notar un carácter cítrico, en esta recreación las maltas prevalecen con un aroma rico a grano, ligera acidez, pan blanco y mucho dulzor derivado de igual forma de las azúcares de la malta, es agradable en general el aroma pero no es lo que se espera en una American Wheat Ale.
El sabor es a granos y pan con una ligera nota acida proveniente de la malta de trigo, los lúpulos si están presentes no aportan mucho en el sabor, el dulzor es moderado en comparación con el aroma y casi no se siente, sabores cítricos escondidos principalmente a cascara de naranja, el cuerpo es muy liviano y casi no presenta textura ya en el paladar, tiene un retrogusto dulce, acido y a naranja que perdura muy poco, efímera y sesionable, una buena opción para el calor, sin embargo para nada es una American Wheat Ale.

Una cerveza muy suave pero para la gente que quiere aprender este tipo de sabor que es tan diferente a las lager me parece una buena opcion pues tiene muy poco amargor

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 1D). Bottle 35.5 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: low grainy and slight doughy aroma. slight malt sweetness. faint citrusy hop note. APPEARANCE: pale yellow color and slightly hazy. small white head with poor retention. TASTE: low grainy malt flavor with slight cardboard notes. medium-low to low bitterness. no hop flavors PALATE: medium-low to low body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: an american wheat ale that lost its charm maybe due to be at the end of its Best Before date.
Hazy, pale yellow color. Medium-sized , white head . Aroma of malt , apricots , peach , orange. Sweet , malty taste . High carbonation . Not bad, but flavor is too weak and carbonation too high.

Pours a yellow color. About one finger white head. A little cloudy, not as much as I would have expected. Okay retention, okay lacing.

Aroma is slightly lemony. Its bready. Bran flakes? Not a lot going on. Smells like water. Everything about the aroma is faint.

Taste is lemony, bready, watery. It has a bit of grit to it. There’s not a lot to it. Slightly bitter, I think more bitter than 18 IBUs.

Mouthfeel is light body. It’s so light, and would make a great summer beer. It’s quite dry. That bitterness lingers. Bit.

Overall, it’s not that great. There are tons of better wheat beers out there. I would drink it again. But I’m not going to rush out and buy it again. I would recommend this as a summertime, hot day beer, but necessarily for my own cooler. But hey, I do recommend you give this a try, because then you’ll have a better appreciation for better wheat beers.

Bottle from Hakim, thanks - Color: cloudy pale blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: nice fruity domination. Peach and apricot nose. Small yogourt finish. Taste: light medium body with sweet malt and sweet cereal. Balanced with fruity as peach and apricot. Sweet finish. Cereals. good attenuation and really drinkable. Yoghurt notes. Thnx to the representive ( yes, apparently GI has a representive now in BE, as they will soon start to import this brewery in Belgium. In their place, there’s some of the inevitable hoppiness that makes a beer "American" or "urban" or "hipster." But even that is fairly controlled.

Bottle, 355ml. A semi-cloudy beer with a medium size foamy white head that fades away after a couple of minutes. It has a fruity aroma of wheat, lemon and citrics. Taste is very mild. 355ml bottle from Albert Heijn. The beer is hazy yellow colored and pours a small and unstable white head, with average carbonation. The aroma of the beer is nice. Malty aromas of some bread and a bit hay-ish. The hops give some leaf notes and some fruity touches. The yeast is creamy and gives a slight spicy note. It is nice, but not very aromatic. Could be stronger and a bit more intense. 
The taste has the same flaw. It is nice, but could and should be a bit more intense. Sweet malts, bitter hops and a slight sour touch in there from some fruits...in the far back.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 12/1/2014. Pours lightly hazy golden straw color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a good amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, light banana/clove, wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with good balance of fruity/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and bready malt notes; with decent strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, light banana/clove, wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, pear, apple, white grape, light banana/clove. wheat, biscuit, herbal, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Nice robustness and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and bready malt notes; with a good malt/bitterness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and light-medium bodied; with a very smooth, fairly crisp, and lightly bready/creamy mouthfeel that is good. Alcohol is well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 4.2%. Overall this is a nice pale wheat ale. All around good robustness and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and bready malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A nicely enjoyable offering.

Weizen komt in de buurt. Aroma is lychee en wat ander licht zuurzoetigs. Smaak is erg licht, waterig fruit als peren in de aanbieding bij de AH. Ehhhhh.... Laat dit biertje nou net bij de Appie gekocht te zijn. Dat kan beter. Alleen nasmaak is zacht en bevalt wel, smaak plus 1.

DAA; Bottle 35,5cl. Pours cloudy straw with plenty of sediments with a shortlived white head. Nose is moderate wheat, yeast, citric and spice. Taste is light sweet and bitter with a short finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

American wheat ale with a pretty hazy yellow blonde colour and thinnish, egg-white, moussy head breaking open in instants but leaving a retaining rim around the edge of the glass. Aroma indeed has a lot of wheat, along with impressions of peach, straw, sweat, cheese, gooseberry, cake, some vague peppery spiciness, grassy hops, yoghurt, hint of lemon juice and honey; adding the deposit also adds a faint hint of damp cloth or rainwater as well as DMTS (burning rubber). Crisp taste with good fruitiness to start with, green apple, apricot and pineapple, medium carbonation, quickly appearing wheat sourishness and ’soapiness’, refreshing, light spicy yeasty notes, bready pale malts in the background with a subtle, sweet honey touch; supple mouthfeel, rather thin but this cannot come as a surprise seen the relatively low ABV. The gentle wheat sourishness accompanies the finish aided by a herbal, soft but still drying hop bitterishness, more so than in traditional European-style wheat beers; in that sense, this is, I guess, a typical example of an American wheat. Not quite the quality standard I normally would expect from this brewery, but refreshing and quenching.

#3700. 355 ml. bottle @ home. Bottled on 26/01/2015 – BBF 26/01/2016. I still cannot believe that I actually bought this in a supermarket (albeit an NL owned one) in Belgium. Hopefully this is one step closer to my dream of buying BCBS in the supermarket. Hazy yellow wheat, light orange, not a big one but okay white head. Sweetish, light lactic wheat nose, touch unpleasant rotting wheat, citrus,…. Taste is old yeast, sweet very sugary wheat, lemonade, aspirin, sugar, lightly fizzy saccharine, old white bread, plenty of aspirin wheat, touch moldy yeast mixed with wheat in the back,… Body is crushed medication & corn wheat,… Okay & prob. better than the ratings but indeed this is a good beer for solid non-expensive drinking + going for a cheap but solid option but not really more.

Taste: Wheat lingers into finish, low hop bitteress with some American or citrus hops, crisp finish



Mouthfeel: medium body, good carbonation, soft profile



Overall: Very wheaty, doughy flavor, some hop bitterness but not too much. Good wheat beer, but ultimately unsatisfying.

12oz bottle from Mitsuya’s in Asagaya, Tokyo. Hazy golden yellow with a small quickly dissipating head. Fake honey aroma, with wheat and slight yeast aromas. Powdery on the palate. Not much taste to it at all. Not a good beer.
Not the best Wheat ale, but it is very drinkable since they are a lot bad beers in the market, would defeitnaly would like to try more from these guys
Pours a hazy yellow with a very thin white head. Aroma is skunky wheat and some lemon. Flavor is sweet malt. Very light in flavor, but it is crisp. Nothing memorable.

Delivers what it promises. Good refreshing summer beer. I give this one a few bonus points because it put goose island on the map.

Pours a hazy light piss color from a bottle. Not much to speak of, bland aroma and flavor.
Pours a golden yellow with thick white head. Nose is light with yeast and grain. Taste is sweet, malty, bread. Not bad.

Bottle, 355ml. Clear pale golden with a frothy to minimal white head. Grainy aroma of citrus, cereal, yeasts. Medium to light bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Sweet with no bitterness. Refreshing fruitiness with a plesant maltiness. Easy and drinkable, but nothing special.
Keg @ Firefly. Hazy gold with a small head. Nose is Apple and peach, honeyed bread. Flavor is pretty bready. Wheat character. Honey and white sugar. Simple and easy drinking.
Slightly opaque gold. Smells nice, wheaty, albeit with a bit of lemonade. A nice wheat ale, very refreshing and fruity. Pretty solid stuff that you could drink happily for a session.

16 oz. can pours a hazy yellow with a two finger white head and very little lacing. Aroma is muted, but has wheat, grass, and a hint of malts. Tastte is middle-of-the road verging toward bitter instead of sweet. Body is light with average carbonation and with a crisp mouthfeel. I;m sorry that I’m rating this in January rather than after mowing the lawn in July, when it would seem more refreshing and less boring.
Golden malty goodness. This is a good beer! It has everything that a well balanced beer should have! Highly recommend!

12 oz bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is faint: some waxiness and herby hops. Flavor is also pretty muted. A bit of nutty sweetness at beginning, then dominated by a mild, ascerbic herby hop character. Medium-light body with a thin, yet creamy mouthfeel and average carbonation. Overall, really not very good at all.
Draft poured a hazy gold with a slight citrus aroma. The taste is a little bit bitter with a hint of a citrus taste (orange?) and a smooth finish.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy straw with airy but stable white head. Clear aroma of malt, hops and citrus, with notes of yeast. Bitter, hoppy flavour, with notes of citrus and yeast and malty touches. Acidic and rough finish. Lively carbonation but the mouthfeel is slightly watery nonetheless. Okay, drinkable, but nothing particularly impressive.

Drank from a twelve ounce bottle, first time rating it on ratebeer, have had it on tap in Chicago. I don’t smell most the aromas since I am sick. A very, very good wheat beer. A very well balanced beer not overpowering in any category.
Average. Middle of the road. Typical for the bland “wheat beer” style. Nothing to get excited about, nothing to be offended by. Probably everyone will like it, yet no one will love it. Yawn.
Better than the Pale ale of the same name. By a lot. Fuck that other beer. But, by the same token this beer is pretty average, so whatever.

Poured from bottle. Aroma of citrus and spruce. Pours a hazy pale colour with white head. Taste is very light bitter. Light body, thin texture, with a bit of a watery finish. Seems like an alright summer beer, but nothing special. Mine was bottled on 1 March 2014 so it might have been a bit too old.

Sampled from a bottle in Chicago. A hazy pale golden colour with a thin white head. Lots of good hop aromas. The taste is quite tart and fruity, with hints of honey. Not much bitterness in the taste. A good thirst quencher, quite mild flavours and just a little bland.
Bottled; Nose is wheat ,lemon grass, spice , yeast. Hazy golden/yeasty beer. Wheaty sweet/rich palate, tart spicy dry finish; This American wheat beer is as good as many German equivalents .

[6098-20131214] Bottle. Corn mash aroma. Clear, yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Sweet mashed grains flavour. Light body. Fair. (5/3/6/3/11) 2.8

Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher weißer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht fruchtig, malzig, hefig, Citrus. Geschmack dezent hopfig fruchtig, Citrus, hefig, unspektakulär.
Bottle. Pours a transparent golden with a layer of off white head. Aroma and taste of basic malts with some hops.

April 27, 2013 - Goose Island 312 Urban Wheat is going places thanks to it’s new corporate backing and heavy marketing pushes. One of the vanguards of this brewery’s march across the country is their wheat, which like many others, is an approachable, cool and quenching beer, though the flavor lacks anything exciting or pronounced. The nose fares somewhat better, where wafts of light honey and white wine provide a nice perfume. The flavor is a regular old wheal ale, thin and a little blander than the average, and in a way that produces an active dislike.

Quality microbrew and a pleasant surprise on board United; too hoppy for my own hedonistic tastes of course, but it’s a fairly complex and layered beer for a 4.2% abv/for this style. Not a bad intro to the hipster-ish US scene :)
Little to differentiate this from countless other beers (just the barest hint of wheat). Best feature is it’s low alcohol content - not that I’d be tempted to have another.
Pours a cloudy gold color with great lacing. Has poor head retention though. Tastes of hay and wheat. A good beer, but nothing memorable.
on tap at Cavanaugh’s at 19th & Sansom - not all that good. I’ve been hearing a lot about Goose Island lately and expected more.

12oz bottle - 

Aroma - floral/citrus hops, light caramel and touch of straw 

Appearance - golden amber body, clear w/ a fluffy white head, medium retention. 

Mouthfeel - medium carbonation, medium body 

Flavor - bright citrus flavors, good balance of caramel malts and citrus hops 

Overall - great drinkability, affordable and a nice introduction pale ale.
Very easy drinking, smooth and nice beer. It has a bit fo a wheat stink to it tha tI like, makes you remember that it’s not a pale lager. Not too much sweetness.

A great basic beer. I could drink a few of these in a row. Don't suffer with light beer when you can have one of these for 135 calories: my go to drink.
Pours a cloudy straw with a thin white head. Smells of melted honey and wheat. Taste has a hint of honey and banana but it’s very long lasting. not an offensive beer but not a world beater either.

Bottle - pours hazy straw with a crisp white head. Aroma of clove, wheat and yeast. Taste of banana, lemon and orange with a little bit of sweet wheat and clove to finish. Light body, prickly carbonation.

"I have a bit of a soft spot for hoppy wheats. This one is light, but does the trick. Light wheat, yeasty spice and citrus hops combined to make a light refreshing brew. 38 in Chicago, but I’m in the airport pretending its warmer."

Transfer from BA review on 4-16-13-

 Poured from bottle into a pint glass

 Appearance – The beer pours a lightly hazed golden yellow color with a big and billowy white head. The head has a great level of retention, slowly fading to leave a nice level of lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell – The aroma is of a grainy wheat smell with a strong hint of a lemon citrus and some sweeter fruit aromas of an orange nature. Mixed with all these are some aromas of a yeasty and grassy aroma as well.

 Taste- The taste begins with a smooth bready flavor upfront. As the taste moves on, more grainy wheat flavors come to the tongue with some of the citrus detected in the nose coming to the tongue as well. The citrus is quite light however and is much less then would have been detected in the nose. The little bit of lemon and wheat flavors are soon joined by some grassy hop and more yeasty flavors in the end, leaving a rather smooth and crisp wheat bread flavor to linger on the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel –The body of the beer is on the slightly lighter side in its thickness with a carbonation level that is on the average side. The thinner body is nice for keeping it a refreshing brew while the medium carbonation is good for balancing the drinkability with the nice grainy flavors.

 Overall – A rather refreshing and quite nice drinking brew. It has a nice light body with a good blend of grainy wheat and light grassy and citrus flavors to make for a good session brew.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Outstanding scent of hops and citrus
Appearance- A great color, resembles a deep copper shade of orange.. 
Taste- Excellent flavor, wheat beers are one of my favorite styles. This brew has a lot of character with a strong showing of malt, hops, and citrus. Palate- Full body with a slick texture that has a nice long smooth aftertaste.
Good session-strength wheat beer. Not a lot of flavors but crisp, clean and highly refreshing.

Bottle. Sweet and fruity, peaches, crackers, and a bit of wheat in the nose. Light hazy medium straw color. Grass, grain, with light hopping. Thin body. Moderate in all aspects. Wheat doesn’t come out much. This one does not impress. Except for the fruit notes, this is perilously close to mass market stuff. Has AB-InBev been playing with the recipes?

Served on-tap at Pickle’s pub in Ocean City, MD.




A - Pours pale yellow with a nice one finger tall white head leaving light streaks of lace down the glass.




S - Fairly dull with hints of sweet bready malt, light citric fruit, pepper, and some faded hops. Fairly simple really.




T - Starts off with a big dose of spicy yeast that quickly gives way to a mix of chewy wheat, dulled earthy hops, light citric fruit, and some light peppery spice. The finish is pretty chewy with a tiny bit of hop bitterness, lingering on the pallet for some time.




M - Medium-Light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Chewy feel, lingering through the finish.




O - Not really my cup of tea but I still enjoyed this one. It was a perfect beer for the beach with just enough flavor to keep me coming back for more.
Aroma has average hop and lemon scent. Golden hazy appearance. Refreshing taste with above average carbonation, good on a hot day. Citrus on the palate. Hint of lemon finish. Good summer beer.

Bottle from red elephant in truro uk. Looks nice - pale wheaty yellow with soft white head. Good carb. Pretty boring taste and aroma. Don't get much aroma - very slight wheaty ness. I'll stick to german and Belgian wheats if this is what an American wheat is like (first one).

Hmm surprised to realize I've never given this popular beer a proper review, although I know I've had this on draft and in bottles on several occasions. I guess it's never struck me as something worth writing about, as it's an alright but overall uninspiring rendition of a wheat ale. Only mildly hazy for the style, orange gold color, plain wheaty aroma with some light candy/caramel malt and floral lemony notes. Goose island 312 Urban Wheat ale. This beer is a golden hazy straw yellow brew with a very slight white head made up of small bubbles. The nose is faint of wheat, malted grains and just a slight amount of hops. The body is fluid and slightly lively. The taste is a good deal more malt than you usually find in wheat beers with the typical wheat character of mild good sour almost completely absent. A decent beer for typical drinking. about one step up from a run of the mill macro lager.
It is clean, bready/yeasty, predictable. It pours yellow. I would not kick it to the curb but it may bore me enough to only drink this on Mondays.

Taste/Palate: There is a light clean bready/biscuit like malt base with a very light hop bitterness. The finish is snappy and the light body and texture are refreshing.

Pours pale and slightly cloudy, like a Victorian horizon rendered in light amber instead of gray-blue. More transparent than wheat beers tend to be. Minimal lacing after a head that shrinks immediately, then lingers at half its original height. Nose is the must of yeast in bread, but not the thick or sour kind: Decent. Taste is, for lack of a better word, skeletal. You detect the outlines of structure floating in water like an anchored wishbone, but nothing else save the nip of bitterness defanged, bitterness that mixes with wheat that tastes thin and slightly stale, more saltine cracker than loaf. The taste isn’t unpleasant, just as saltines can slake hunger, but it conjures the kinds of thin, dry beer I’ve avoided for years (Corona, Amstel Light, etc.). That’s something I never expected from a brewery that can be as excellent as Goose Island. Luckily, I have a bottle of their Bourbon County Brand Coffee Stout in the fridge to remind me of their greatness.

Bottle.

A- Lemons, spices, wheat.

A- Golden color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Slightly spicy, mild bitterness, subtle lemon notes.

O- A lot spicier than I was expecting. Quite complex and could use more citrus tones.

12 oz bottle poured into a shaker. The aroma nothing special. It’s not offense, but it’s faint faint. It has some light citrusy-sweet aroma to it (mostly lemon), accompanied by some floral notes and a light hop scent. It pours straw yellow with a thin, white head that, pours strong, but recedes quickly. There’s nothing too dramatic in the taste either; having a mild sweetness throughout, and a light, pleasantly sour note at the finish. Initially tastes lemony with some bread-like flavor to it - maybe some clove-like spice in there too. It finishes closer to apple juice with some orange in it. The initial sips are highly carbonated, and the fizziness keeps some presence throughout, but by the end, it’s a bit more malty and syrupy. Generally finishes clean, although pairing it with food seems to recall the apple traces in the flavor and a very faint hop taste. Although my scores are generally low, this has been a goto session beer for me for a long time, and will likely continue to be so - none of the flavors are overwhelming or offensive, so it’s a crowd-pleaser and it pairs well with just about any food offering without enhancing or masking any flavors. The ABV and calorie count are relatively low too, so it’s easy to throw back a couple of these without doing too much damage.

Goose Island brews some highly acclaimed and sought-after beers. That said, many people believe that they’ve taken a sharp decline in overall quality since being acquired by AB-InBev in 2011, and their mainstream beers are the ones thought of to have taken the largest hit. Honestly, I haven’t had many Goose Island beers; I’m pretty sure I’ve had their IPA and their Honkers Ale, but that’s about it. I’m not sure what exactly makes their 312 an “urban” wheat ale, but I’m interested to see what it’s all about.



Appearance (3/5)
The beer pours a slightly hazy light gold-to-straw with a bright white fizzy head and dissipates fairly quickly. The glass I used does not have a nucleation point, but there was still a steady stream of bubbles coming up from the bottom. (The glass should’ve been clean, but who knows.)



Aroma (4/10)
312 has a faint sweet smell that has notes of grass, biscuit, and honey. There are some faint citrus notes, primarily lemon and orange, with absolutely no apparent bitterness. At the end there is a faint soapy note.



Taste (12/20)
Goose Island’s Urban Wheat is definitely light. The taste is definitely that of an American style wheat beer, with bread and biscuit being accompanied by honey sweetness, some lemon citrus. In the finish there is a bit of astringency that comes off similar to a mild dish soap. 



Drinkability (3/5)
312 is slick, but drinkable. The carbonation dies down after a few minutes, and the mouthfeel is light-to-medium. It isn’t remarkable, so I won’t waste too much time.



Intangibles (4/10)
Goose Island’s 312 Urban Wheat beer is mild, drinkable, and ultimately forgettable. While I’ll admit that it does have some interesting qualities, especially the light honey notes that are presented throughout the nose and palate, it isn’t a beer that jumps out as anything I would bend over backwards to buy.



Overall (26/50)
Drank this six PAC with some friends way late at night and after way too much rum. Found it clean and refreshing. Definitely getting it again.

Palate should really be more like a 3.5: light body, creamy, lively, with a lingering bitter finish. Would not buy again.
Yellow cloudy. Aroma is weak. Medium carbonation. Not great. Lemony bitter aftertaste. Watery.
Bottle from local market, Espoo. Originally rated 25112011. Colour is hazy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Sweetness, grain, wheat and fruits.

Slightly hazy yellow brew with the smell of lemon. Other than the lemon zest there doesn’t seem to be much else going for this one. Pretty boring brew with nothing really making me want to purchase more. Glad I got a sampler bottle rather than a whole six pack.
Pretty good wheat beer. I’ve had better, but I would drink this one again. Nice light citrus flavor.
Aroma and appearance are unspectacular, mouth feel is nice but doesn?t tickle many buds and it?s mild taste fades.

35.5cl bottle. Cloudy gold to the eye, with plenty of bubbles. Not much aroma or taste. Slight citrus notes, with malt aftertaste. If I had to drink this again, I would guess that it could accompany crisps or nuts.

Much better than most "summer brews" out there. What sets this apart is that it is balanced...no aspect overwhelms the others. Balance gentlemen. Something that is missing from many craft beers these days.
Pours a hazy light golden with a quickly diminishing head. Some citrus aroma. Nicely made typical wheat beer, but nothing stands out.

Hazy golden wheat beer. Nice wit style beer but nothing to write home about- understated (by which I mean a little bland) but immensely drinkable because of this. Leaves a nice coating afterwards though so helps with the mouthfeel

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Enjoyed this one before the craft beer revolution took me over, but after some context, this is a pretty poor wheat beer.
se presenta con un color amarillo claro media turbia con un ligero toque citrico, muy suave al paladar sin aromas ni sabores particulares,muy buena para quitar la sed en el verano caliente

[US West Coast Trip 2013] Ja.... Servitören sa att de hade en Goose Island 312 IPA. Nice tänkte jag. Men vad fick man in? Inte smakade det som en IPA. Och deras vanliga IPA var det inte då jag gillade den! Så detta måste vara ölen jag fick.... Original kommentar: "Att kalla detta en IPA är att smutsa ned namnet begreppet IPA. Förvånansvärt dålig! Smakar som en dålig veteöl eller lager! Har jag fått fel öl? Tydligen inte enl. Servitören....."

Date tasted: June 19, 2013... Glassware: pilsner glass... Occasion: NBA Finals Game 7--it better be fantastic for the Spurs!... Appearance: golden body with enough effervescence to steady a massive off-white head that fills the 22 oz. glass; laces to a misty top... Aroma: citric refreshment with Cascade and lemony zest; fresh and appropriate for a fan-cooled evening... Palate: soft yet active at the throat; enough substance to be considered between sips--refreshing and drinkable... Taste: not as much taste as the aroma suggests; lemony fizz and some undergirding hops... Overall: Lucky enough to have had this on tap a week ago in Chicago; this bottle is similar in mouthfeel and sudsy flavor; crisp and effective in its refreshment--haven’t really had a bad Goose Island yet....

On tap 0,5l at Elephant & Castle in Chicago. Pours a golden colour and leaves almost no head nor lacing. Aroma of nothing. Taste light citrus and then not much else. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a yellow colour, taste is lemony and zesty, ok but not a great example of the style

A somewhat disappointing wheat beer from Goose Island, in the sense that isn’t remarkable. It tastes more like a lager with a tinge of wheat, not like a full wheat. At the price not worth it compared to a much cheap macro domestic.

On tap at a Beef o’ Bradys. Overall not a bad beer, more like a watered-down pale ale though. The wheat character comes out as it warms up, getting sweet also I might add. Light hops, malt and body (InBev, go figure) make for a good sports bar beer.
Cloudy yellow/gold with thick foamy lacy white head; aroma of vanilla; Flava is light; feels light and slightly fizzy; finishes light
Pours a hazy gold with good white head and high carbonation. Doughy smells with hints of spicy hops, not much citrus. Slightly soapy finish.
Hazy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma is wheat and faint citrus. Tasteis wheat with orange in the background. Crisp. Nice beer to have in the summer.
Bottle: Color: Pastel Yellow.  Aroma: Pineapple/ Bread/ Fruit.  Flavor: Slightly watered down, light vanilla and bread flavor.

Draft at Omaha airport. Poured a golden yellow pale color. Small head. Aromas of orange, lemon, slight citrus hop.  Light sweetness. Somewhat dry finish. Average carbonation. Smooth and refreshing with a spicey finish.

fruity wheat smell. cloudy straw color. Taste like a wet dough ball, thin on the mouth for as doughy as it taste. Nothing to bad about it but nothing stands out about it. This was from the can and not the bottle.

This a great beer. This is what beer should taste like. Easy to drink, great taste, great buzz. I discovered this beer at craft beer place here in Fremont, Ca. and I am really glad I did. By far my favorite beer out there..

Bottle. Straw yellow and cloudy with a steady white head. Lovely hoppy aroma with spices and wheat. Flavourwise it’s really crisp and light but imparts a fair bit of flavour. There’s a wheaty body with dashes of grape, grapefruit, honey and floral notes. Light and breezy and would straddle well between the lager drinkers and the real ale suppers.
Poured pale yellow with white head. Wheat and cereal grain aroma. Cereal  grain followed by wheat flavors. Smooth finish.

12 oz bottle dated 3/15/2013 bottled in Baldwinsville, NY  from a $11.99 12 pk brought from Binnys in Orland Park. Poured into a Franziskaner Weiss glass a hazy,  cloudy golden color leaving a thick bright white 2 finger head. 
Smells of lemon, wet grain husks. 
Somewhat spicy on the tongue at first, med carbonation with lemon ending with a slight soapy finish. 
Very easy drinking, excellent lawnmower beer. Are there more flavorful wheat beers out there? Absolutely. But this one is so easy to drink it’s no wonder it’s a big seller. Always a consideration when I’m shopping for beer. Great session wheat beer.
Bad aroma... skunk... light yellow... a pour mans summer beer.... just not as good as I had hoped!

Aroma is light, wheat heavy. Appearance is a piss yellow, clear. Taste is what it is: light, wheat beer. The mouthfeel is meh; carbonated, but not so much. Overall, it’s forgettable, but better than a Budweiser.
From a bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Smells like hops and nectarines. Tastes like wheat, cereal, light malt, light hops. Light body and low carbonation.
Rather good beer. little heavy on the carbonation. but has a very good flavor. I will have this again.
Flat and macro-looking in the glass.  Not much interest on the nose.  Kind of a creamy/foamy/pulpy palate.  Wheat, light generic hopping.  Underwhelming.

I’ll make this one quick.  This beer sucks.  Aroma is OK at best but barely there (probably a good thing).  Taste is horrible.  It’s too fizzy.  Just a crappy mcmess.  Avoid.  This costs as much as many other much better wheat beers.
A cloudy pale yellow. Aroma of citrus and some hops. There is a bit of a spicy bite to it. This is a refreshing wheat beer in general.

12 oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Pours a hazy golden color. A rocky two-finger white head is formed; it doesn’t have the best retention by any means.

S: Bland. Touches of lemon esters augment some faint noble hopping...and that’s about it.

T: It starts with a bit of lemon, and ends with wheat malt flavors. This is really damn bland, though hardly a bad brew.

M: A bit too chalky on the palate - as such, it’s not as drinkable as it could be.

O: Did I mention bland? Yeah. It’s completely inoffensive though, so this wouldn’t be a bad choice if the only other offerings were BMC (wait a minute...)

The appearance and presence of yeast on the bottom is what sold it to me.  I poured it into a German beer glass and first noticed a citrus aroma.  That was the best of it...from then on it was a hoppy bitterness that I associate with many "rough around the edges" craft beers, followed by a disappointing thin taste and a lingering bitter finish.  To me, this brew was not ready for market.
Light sweet aroma. White head. Yellow color. Sweet orange flavor, not terribly strong.
Pretty good wheat ale. It’s like Goose Island’s take on cheap beer... I can dig it.
Light sweet aroma with a modest white head on a urine colored body.  Fairly strong sweet flavor with a light finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a one finger fluffy white. Slight citrus aroma, as well as some wheat. Pretty light on taste, but clean. Wheat, bready malts, some orange peel, and lemongrass.
I am a big fan of heffewiezen so I was initially disappointed with this beer. By the time I got to the end of the six pack however I changed my mind and my rating.  Good smooth refreshing wheat beer.

Just plain awful.  Exponentially cloying. Disappointing offering from Goose Island.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bottle.  Aroma of yeast, grass, citrus.  Crisp, light, slightly but pleasantly bitter. Light hop flavor.  Taste hints of citrus.  Lively carbonation but not overly so.  Went really well with salad.  Glad I tried this.  We definitely reach for this on a summer’s day.
Pours hazy yellow with a thin fizzy head. Wheat aroma but fades on the tongue. Not bad but certainly skippable.

Pint at the Durham Bulls Athletic Park. Fizzy yellow, not much head. Weird prickly overcarbonation. Nose of grain, corn, wheat, and some grassy hops. Taste is sweet and any real flavor is obscured by bubbles. Blech.

Bought at Krogers on Broadway in North Knoxville.
Cloudy yellow. Medium white head.  Aroma: Citris, malts, perfume. Flavor: Wheat, orangees, malt. Mellow finish.

Not a bad beer, very drinkable but nothing impressive.  My limited taste for the Goose has done better.  Really, my Scruffy Little City of Knoxville can do better than the Windy City.

Murky straw-colored beer with a lot of effervescence that produces a fizzy white head. Smells faintly of spice, bananas, and a little citrus. Taste is a little bitter up front, which develops into a slight sour spiciness, but overall the flavor profile is quite bland. It has a vibrant, bubbly mouth feel, which is good for this style, but that’s not enough to save this beer from mediocrity. Underwhelming.

EDIT: I squeezed a lemon into the next glass I drank, and that improved things a bit. But this is still a pretty bland beer.
@ 8bucks a 6 pack I expected more then a half ass attempt of a home brew gone commercial. Disappointed.

Bottle from a supermarket in Chicago and drunk in the park across the street last summer. It had a nice cloudy gold look like a classic wheat beer. The aroma was slightly fruity & spicy and the taste was a solid wheat beer. Not outstanding but a very solid, drinkable and sessionable white beer for the summer.

Bottle from 7-11: Poured a neon glowing yellow hue with slight transparency of white tint while a fluffy topping of head rested on top. Aroma is mild with a crisp scent of higher quality malts than most other American wheat beers use and there is also perhaps a whiff of clove or ginger as well. The drink is soft with a clean taste of wheat malts that also brings about a taste of bitter lime. Okay stuff and I could only imagine how refreshing this beer would be on a hot summer day, but for how expensive this beer is, it might easily be skipped in the future.
Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow appearance, white foamy small head, doughy aroma, slightly tangy citrusy taste, average carbonation, long finish. A bit watery for an ale.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours Cloudy Yellow, medium white head not a lot of lacing. Not a lot of aroma on this one, some wheat and some fruit but very faint. Taste is also a bit bland sort of watery, citrus fruit grain; Perhaps light and refreshing - Just OK...

Bottle into frosted pint glass- getting hints of lemon, straw... I poured slowly at an angle and still had over 1 inch head. Great carbonation, but a bit dry in the finish. This beer is good but a bit bland in the end. Maybe an orange slice would give it some bonus points. If your a lawnmower beer kinda guy... You will most likely enjoy this beer.

Pours a hzy yellow with a slight fruit aroma.  Taste is unfiltered hops which gives it a grainy taste during the swallow.  A slight spicyness leading to a smooth yet thin finish.  A decent wheat ale that was unassuming and not complex.

Poured from a bottle into a tall glass. Appearance is hazy yellow with a white foamy head. A bit of lacing. Smell is wheat, hay, a little fruity. Taste is a little fruity up front, straw, and finishes quickly. Not much to it.
on tap in NY. pours a cloudy yellow. aroma is of hops and straw...and wheat, taste is much the same. bit of fruit.
generic taste, cool bottle, chicago brewed, and nice to drink in nice weather
Citrusy aroma.  Bright yellow body with cloudy white appearance after swirling in the yeast.  Mostly lemon with a bit of floury taste.  Not super smooth, tastes too much like a light beer.

A: Hazy gold. Almost no head or bubbles. Not much lacing.
A: Floral, wheaty
T: Smooth, sweet, light, refreshing.

A lot of crackle and fizz while being poured, this beer is a standard, yellow fizzy beer with a foamy head.  There’s really no aroma.  Not much of a taste, either.  A bit of wheat malt and a slightly sweet aftertaste.  Meh.
Mediocre at best. Bland, wheat ale that has light yellow color similar to bud light.  Nothing special
From bottle, not impressed with this at all. Basically a half assed heartless beer.
Cloudy golden yellow pour with white soapy head.  Weak aroma of lemon, spice, and grass.  Lemon, orange, slight spice, and grain flavor.  Very drinkable, but not impressive.

One of the better American wheats I had. Has the good wheat flavor and refreshing components but a nice hop finish that adds flavor but is also in line with the crisp aspect. Similar idea to three Floyd’s gumball, not as good but very well done.

Clean but undistinguished.  Very light aroma profile with touches of bread.  Hazy yellow golden with a fading head (probably a bad pour from the tap).  Some citrus and floral hop flavors with a bread backbone and a balanced taste.  Light to medium-light bodied with a crisp finish.
Draft. Pours hazy hay. Fairly bland, unoffensive, smoothness all around. It’s like the bud light of wheat beers. Even less flavor than Blue Moon.
On tap - this is the beer that started the trend of stupidly naming your beer after a zipcode/area code/busline/etc.

Bottle poured into weizen. Appearance is a hazy golden color with orange tint and big white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is yeast, lemon zest, and spicy hops. Taste is wheat and light citrus, though it’s a bit weak. This is ok, but nothing special.
355ml Bottle from Borough Wines 2013/4/17 Best Before: 2013/11/14 Pretty average and delicate wheat beer. Not impressed.
Okay beer, nothing amazing, had it on draft. Actually thought it was bud light before after i took a sip. Good color and full bodied hefe beer.
Very nice although somewhat incipit. Nice aroma of chicory and sfot to drink on logn sips.

Hazy yellow pour. Minimal lacing. Faint yeast aroma. Smooth start, slightly bitter finish. Not a pleasant aftertaste. Had better

Pretty average wheat beer. It is easy on the palate which makes it drinkable, but not much to write home about. It’s just ok.
honestly no better or worse than 90% of the american wheat ales out there. its still take a german hefe or belgian wit over the style though.
Draft at phillies game. Pour us a haze gold with a lace head. Aroma is a lite malt. Taste is a nice bitter, smooth. Finish is clean. A good ale.
Very good offering of a wheat beer, with a creamy yet earthy finish a highly drinkable wheat beer

Pours light straw, finger of thick white head, very cloudy.  Wheat, spicy hop on the nose, not a whole lot there. Flavor is watered down, wheat malt and spicy hops as in the nose, a bit faint heffe type yeast. Low body, low carbonation very crisp, rather dry.  Overall pretty bad, I don?t think I?ll ever have one of these again, unless the only other option is an adjunct lager.

Cloudy gold beer with a white head. Faint aromas of wheat and caramel. Tastes of wheat, barley, mild citrus notes and some bitter flavors. Semi-sweet caramel finish. Easy to drink and mildly refreshing. A bit flat and lackluster, but a decent beer.

35.5cl bottle: BBD 27 Aug 2013. Poured into a ’Coors’ Banquet flute at home on 2 Apr 2013.

Light golden hazy body with a full head of snow white bubbles on top, loads of carbonisation bubbles on the side of the glass and rising through the brew to replenish the head.

Lemon and other citrusy notes hit the nose, mixed with some yeastiness and hints of clove. Nothing overly strong, but combined they add up to an interesting aroma.

The taste follows the smell: citrus, yeasty, with some herb/spice characteristics to give the beer extra flavour.

I am not a big fan of wheat beers, or citrusy flavoured ales: this however blended the two nicely together and I quite enjoyed the experience.

Lively, crisp and refreshing: not bad at all, a summer drink though.

355 ml bottle.

Slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Wheat and somewhat semi-cloying weird fruit loop flavored. Light and a little dry.

Yeah, you know....fuggginnn. Snifter.  Bottle. Hazy yellow body. White fizzy head. Grass and citrus aroma. Wheat, triscuit, and sweet finish. I expected more I guess. Not bad though.
