...light straw yellow color, a little wheat and bananna on the nose.  Low carbonation.  Flavor of wheat, with awatery finish.  Was looking for something more here but, oh well, nothing special.  Finished watery, with a hint of wheat, and nothig else.  Won’t buy again.

Draft (and bottles). Pours a light hazy golden body with white head. Aroma is light wheat, light lemon cleaner and yeast. Mouthfeel is medium to thin with notes of lemon, grain, bitter wheat, very faint hop and a touch of sweetness. Not a huge fan of this wheat.
Apr 2012 - Poor wheat beer, perhaps the worse to date?  No - I must have had a worse British attempt!  Slight spice taste, tastes like watered down citrus juice.

So excited that GI is distributed here now. Stopped by First Street for a pint of this after work. Poured into a tall 312 weizen glass.

A murky pale gold with a small white head on top. Good retention and decent spotty lace left behind. The nose is sweet and bready. Honey biscuits, grains, and a kiss of lemon zest. 

Creamy feel. Good carbonation smack on the finish. Wheat, straw, mild spices, pale citrus, apple. A simple tasty beer. I couldn’t see myself having multiples of these at a time, but a decent refreshing beer anyways.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  21.5.2011

Aroma of grain with hints of citrus. Pours a mildly hazy straw color with a rapidly dissipating white head and no lacing. To say that the taste is subdued is being generous. Primarily grainy flavors all the way through to the finish and into the aftertaste. Medium body with soft carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a disappointingly watered down offering from Goose Island.
pale yellow cloudy pour - spicy hops in the nose with some biscuit  - fruity esters of banana and sour raspberry.
American wheat beer that is hazey gold in color with a slight head. If you like wheat beer it’s a go to.

Bottle. Pours medium hazy yellow with a thin, quickly fading head. Aroma is wheat but also slightly off tasting. Slight hint of lemon. Flavour is slightly sweet but if fairly mild. Body is thin and watery with moderate carbonation. Disappointing.
Bottle. Just an average hefeweiss. Cloudy gold. Decent head. Disappears quickly. Taste, is too light and watery. Does have that sweet spice taste. Aroma is also weak.

Pours a light yellow with a thick white head. The aroma is wheat, lemons, and fresh cut grass. The taste is slightly funky off-tasting wheat (not too bad), lemon, and water. Pretty inoffensive wheat beer. Easy to drink a lot of these. Not all that great, a little boring, a little funky from the wheat going bad, nothing special.
Pretty much a basic wheat beer. There’s really not much to add to the description. Some character would have been nice.

Poured from a bottle, hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of spices and lemon. Taste is sweet with a pod tart aftertaste. Good carbonation. Decent wheat, maybe the best one I can get my hands on from local stores.

355ml bottle, Hazy yellow colour, thin white head leaving some lacing and spicy yeast & lemon aroma. Taste is bready malt with wheat notes, and a light grassy bitterness. Light bodied, medium carbonation and dry finish. OK.
Bottled ; London ; UK ; Wheat,hops,citrus and sour aroma ; Yellow hazy color with nice head ; Some wheat and fruit taste with medium bitter finish ; Pretty good modern wheat ale.

Pours a hazy pale golden, thin white head barely lasted until it got to my table, fine lacing my wife called "cute". Nothing unpleasant with the taste of this beer, but nothing outstanding. Goes down good, especially with food. Nothing lingers on the palate,  good or bad.
Not much of a smell but good taste...light and tasty had to chug at pawleys front porch
It’s ok for what is, I’d prefer others I’m it’s category. But otherwise pretty standard for a wheat. Something I’m not digging in the finish or in the nose, a sweet bland maltiness.

Pale gold with a short-lived head and ok lace. Bready aroma with hints of lemon, grass and spices. Bready malts and grassy hop flavors are evident, with touches of wheat. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation and a dry finish.

12 oz bottle. Bottled 1/19/13; about a month and a half old. Pours hazy pale yellow with a smallish white head with decent retention; it falls after a couple minutes, leaving a skiff of foam. Aroma is doughy, citrus powder drink, bland. Taste is lightly sweet and finishes dry; it’s wheaty, crisp, refreshing, watery, inoffensive, dull. Highly carbonated with a creamy mouthfeel. Brainless lawnmower beer that doesn’t taste bad--just really boring.
On tap at T&P.  Light pour with a big white head.  Aroma is oranges and heavy bread.  Taste is a good wheat cut, citrus, and a sweet finish.
roasty, grass, earthy, golden, pale, clear, minimal head, brown, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,
On draft at the lost dog cafe in mclean. Pours a clear pale gold with a white head.  Feint bread aroma.  Grain and feint hop flavors.  Crisp finish.

This poured a hazy straw yellow color with a white head.  Aroma was pretty week, light grass and spicey yeast, not much else.  Flavor was a bit thin bascially pale malt with light yeast and spice notes. Couldn;t really give it anything other than 5/10 because nothing stands out, but nothing offensive at all.

Poured on tap into a pint glass. About 2 fingers of white head. No lacing. Smell of wheat with slight hoppiness. Appearance is cloudy yellow straw. Flavor is pretty good, nothing ground breaking though. A good session beer.
not real special. slightly hazy light yellow gold with pure white head. aroma of hops banana and wheat. tastes like malt wheat and water.

Can->shaker.  Light yellow, small white head.  Aroma has some wheat and hint of hops.  Tastes of hay, wheat, some malt.  Average.
Citrus fruit on the nose.  Hazy, pale orange hue with a lasting, white head.  Dry and somewhat bitter.  Light body, average carbonation, with a citrusy, hoppy finish.

Wheaty citrus nose. Hazy appearance with good head. Taste is hopeless, slight honey, but very bland. Nice Mouthfeel.

Very little to recommend this beer, with many better wheats to choose.
Light with a little cloudyness. Pours with little head has strong wheat flavor with subtle citrus note. Decent but nothing really stands out in it.
Hazy yellow appearance, with nice creamy wheat chaff top. Zesty wheaty nose, with mild graininess. Soft wheat flavor with honeyed grain notes.
A nice wheat ale from Goose Island. Decent flavor and color. For the price of a common beer, it is a good quality.
A cloiudy, straw coloured beer with a thick foamy head. A sweet, dry malt scent. Flavour is a little bland but pleasant. A bit malty, a bit hoppy. Easily drinkable but not remarkable.

On tap at Tap 25. It pours clear yellow color with a white head. The aroma is lemon, orange peel and wheat. The flavor is lemon, orange and wheat…pretty straight forward, but exactly what I want a session wheat ale to taste like, minus a powerful hop display. This would be very refreshing on a hot summer day.
Refreshing beer high drinkability very low fenolic flavors and aroma. It suposse to be the comercial beer of goose island brewery.
More citrusy bud light.  Very little aroma and taste, almost like a re-incarnation of bud light wheat.

easy shit. rather hits the spot

Aroma has hops, some fruits, hay and distant wheaty notes. Flavour is somewhat refreshing with hops, fruits, hay, wheaty notes and some grapefruit. Feels like an English Blond ale – perhaps due to the hop profile. Light bodied and easy‐going.

355ml bottle from Tesco. A slightly hazy amber pour with a ring of white head; yeasty, wheaty aroma - no sign of the promised Cascade hops; soft, creamy texture, that coats the mouth, and some citrussy fruit; then a touch of spice and alcohol to finish - where does that come from in a 4.4% brew. Rather strange, and not an exercise worth repeating.

On tap, Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a light white head that leaves light lacing. Smells of citrus, lemon, wheat and coriander. Tastes of all the same things with a slight clove flavor and sourness. Mouthfeel is medium and chewy with a semi dry finish. Overall It?s not a bad wheat beer but nothing special either.
On tap. Clovey, boring, uneventful. Watery and stale. Why do I have to write more? Avoid this garbage.
Goose Island has better offerings. A cloudy pale ale with some spice notes and fruit notes. Fairly smooth.
Pours a slightly cloudy golden with moderate white head. Nice unfiltered US wheat beer. Lightly hopped with hints of lemon & orange. Nice, refreshing.

Bottle at Monk´s Café, Sveavägen. Pours hazy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma is weak with a hoppy fruitiness dominating, some orange zest, wheat, and yeast as well. Taste follows aroma with a lighl sweetness to it. Very easy drinkable but not enough character to be interesting. Maybe on a hot summer day it will come to it´s right.

Beautiful color, nice, long lasting foam and a mild smell of citrus/banana. Though it fails too keep it up. almost no taste, too fuzzy, no bitterness. Loaded with flavor and character? don’t think so..

Pours hazy light yellow with low head. Aroma is wheat, some fruits, malts. Flavor is refreshing. Wheat, dried fruits malts. Easy to drink.

Eh, a decent wheat ale. Nothing really bad about it but nothing about it really stands out that much either. A good introductory wheat ale I suppose.

Bottle from Tesco. Heather honey blossom aromas with a faint zesty lemon. Cloudy translucent yellow with a good white head and a little lacing. Looks very much like a witbier. After a few minutes I get more nutty malt and in the aroma. Flavour is malt forward with a nice noble hop character. The maltt is a little flat and stale. Zesty finish. Palete is a little light with moderately high carbonation, which leaves a slightly chalky finish. Very refreshing.

A slightly hazy, orange yellow coloured beer with a weakish white head. A light, but distinctly hoppy aroma, citrusy, grassy and a hint of spice. Medium dry mouthfeel. The taste carries on from the aroma. A grassy, citrusy flavour at the beginning, limes and grapefruit in particular, which is balanced by a slightly sweet, biscuity malt flavour, giving the an all-round flavour similar to marmalade. The finish is smooth and lengthy.

312, the quintessential Goose Island.  Pours a syrupy yellowish-orange with a trim off-white head about a fingernail in length. I think this is doubly exciting that I’m drinking this beer in the city it was brewed in. Then again, it’s not as exciting as I was hoping it’d be. Its aroma is very faint, but still noticeable: orange zest extract, wheat grain and yeast. Maybe some sesame seeds lingering at the end? Tastes as it smells: wheaten, grainy, and yeasty with a very prominent seed and formulaic spice component by swallow. Not all the way "meh", it has class and as I’ve said before class goes a long way, but it totally deserves the mean average according the Ratebeer.
Pretty disappointed with this one.  Exceedingly mild and watery, more so than most American wheats.  Grassy hops, weak wheat, and cardboard.

This wheat bier will not disappoint you at all. Top it with an orange slice, and it will take you to the Windy City (Chicago is!). Somehow, I prefer Chicago girls over New York lassies.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a cloudy golden yellow...aroma is faint, lightly citrusy. Flavor is quite citrusy...lemongrass and banana. Very light. Pretty decent though.

Out of a bottle to glass. Aroma of sweet cereal and slight lemon. Some meadow. Hazy golden wheat with fast dissolving white head. Flavor is lemon with wheat background. No bitterness. Refreshing and not too bad.

Cloudy, amber, thick white head; malty aroma like any old pale lager; gentle wheaty, fruity taste; smooth, a little spice, but essentially boring; disappointing for someone whose beer interest was partly rekindled by a particularly fine bottle of their IPA.

Bottle.

Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is light to medium yellow.
	
Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain, husks), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs), with a notes of soap and lemon zest.

Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly husky.

Light to medium body, watery texture, lively/fizzy carbonation.

Very simple, light, and watery, and a bit rough.  Drinkable but barely.

On tap a Taco Mac. Hazy, light yellow color with a small, white head. Notes of biscuits, lemon peels, hard cheese, and cereals. Citrus sweetness and a very light funk in the finish. Light to medium body, dry, acidic, and crisp. This is light, but heavy for a wheat ale, and tasty. More dry and funky than I expected, but a good beer, nonetheless.
Średnie piwo prawdopodobnie zbyt mało słodu i osadu tu użyto bo piwo zapowiadało się ciekawie przy pierwszym łyku. Zbyt mała piana i mętność to spory mninus. Belgijskie wity są bardzij treściwe.

Wife got a bottle of this, I borrowed a few ounces.  Straw yellow color with thin white head.  Very light aroma, detect wheat, fruit and spice notes.  Taste is even lighter then aroma, pale malt sweetness and grass.  Light watery body with medium carbonation.  In a word, bland.  I’m surprised GI has their name on this, o well.

Slightly hazy straw yellow with a bubbly rocky white head.  Aroma was basic wheat and dusty bread tones.  Flavor was nice though, with pleasant notes of wheat, sweet toast, sugary pale grain maltiness, and very low bitterness, though there is a very subtle grassy twang.  Very slight lemon/orange citrus zest in there too.  But a little too light bodied.  At the end of the day, an average wheat beer with slightly above average flavor for its style.

Aroma is watery. It's appearance is great with a medium head everything else is a little sloppy and bland. Not much to palate a slight wheat taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Pours yellow with a slight haze and short head. Aroma of wheat and skunk at first, then some light spicy hops. Light-med body, prickly carbonation, medium creamy texture, and a light wheaty, bitter finish. Minimal sweetness and not a lot of flavor.
Light, clear, doea not smell of wheatyeast. Some hops. Thin body. Not good beer, but better than really bad beer.

On tap at The Burgundian Tavern, pours a clear golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma of light wheat malt, not much else. Flavour of light wheat and not a whole lot else. Very weak and watery, though it is refreshing - just very boring. Not much to say here. OK.
Bottle to sampler cup.  Pours a light yellow, clear & sparse head.  Watery and basic.  Seems they brew this to compete with macrobrew wheats like blue moon & shocktop.  Meh.

Pours a hazy, semi-transparent golden with a fairly thick white head. Aroma is crisp and wheaty with a fruity hint. Flavor fills the mouth with wheaty, grassy and subtle fruity notes. Smooth texture has good body, a fair amount of fizz, and some grassy, straw-like scratchiness. Did they brew this with straw, or hay? Tastes like that - and I mean it positively. Texture has average body and fizz, leaving a grassy and hay-ish finish. Get urban with this one!
Yellow. Very Yellow. Decent sized head. Smells herbal and toasty. Taste is...a little bitter I guess. Odd herbal, medicinal note. Not much going here. I shan’t be getting this again.
Pours hazy straw with little white head retention. Mild aroma of some bread and hay. Bland and boring.
Flaske kjøpt på ica. Uklar gylden farge, nesten ikke skum. Smaker malt,gress,sitrus og et hint av banan. En øl jeg ikke kommer til å kjøpe igjen

12 ounce bottle.  Pours an unclear golden color with a large three inch head that slowly collapses.  Taste is of wheat, grass, spice, some citrus and some hops.  Similar aroma.  Has a decent body for a lower alcohol beer.  Easy to drink, but I was expecting more.

Pint on tap. Slight haze on the pale golden body, with a small ring of foam on top. Faint nose of citrus, dry grain and resin. Taste is an inoffensive blend of the same. Light body is balanced and has medium-high carbonation.

Bouteille de 12 oz achetée chez Beverage Warehouse (Burlington, VT). Arôme: Légère odeur de blé et de coriandre. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de blé avec une pointe de citron. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de blé en arrière goût. (Rating #4368)
yellow color, aroma of citrus and spices, flavors are the same, very light and watery, not much flavor

Draft at Land O Lakes WOB.  Cloudy lemon yellow pour with a medium sized white head that almost completely disappears after a few minutes.  Very weak lacing for a wheat ale.  Weak aroma too.  Mild spiced but that’s about it.  Not much more in the way of flavor either. Slightly fruity with a pinch of hops. Seems to be a very ho hum offering from Goose Island.

Bottle from Tesco. Pale hazy gold colour little or no head. Aroma is weak, a little sweet malt and citrus. Taste is a little overpowered by the bubbles. When you do get to the taste it is sweet malts, citrus and a little a spicy. An OK beer but too carbonated for my liking.

Draft at sb. Pours a cloudy dark gold with a thin and scant whitish head. Mild tangy nose, like an underripe orange on a cold day. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Faint orange-like notes on the mid palate with a fairly vacant finish.

Grainy and grassy aroma, lightly hopped, very thin mouthfeel, pretty watery finish - this is a clean and crisp beer, I bought it out of interest for the wheat ale element but I find it to be a little bit lighter than I was expecting, arguably a good introductory ale for lager fans looking to broaden their drinking.
Bottle. Yellow with white head. Smells like pineapple and yeast. Tastes a bit bitter, very light, straw, watery. Pretty bad beer.
Tap. Cloudy pale yellow color. Foamy white head. Aroma of wheat and coriander, and wintergreen. Flavors matched, with zesty lemon notes and a slight bitter tone on the finish.

shared a bottle with President Obama .. . pours a mild gold, hazy .. . great foam, mild lacing .. . breaking news .. . cereal, creamed corn, and wheat .. . a good simple wheat .. . . and rabbits? .. they nibble and they nibble like they do..

A very unique wheat with a tangy lemony zest.  Pours light yellow with a short head.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tall glass, cloudy yellow with two fingers of head. Looks really nice. Banana bread smell, blunt, little bit of lemon. Watery taste, lemon bitterness. A fair amount of carbonation, medium body and crisp. Looked great, the taste was a letdown, which makes it fairly average for a wheat.

-Fish!

On tap at Benjamin’s. Slightly hazy golden amber with medium foamy lacing off-white head. Mild aroma with some citrus zest, yeast, and a bit of wheat. Medium watery body with medium carbonation. Light sweet malt and wheat, with a bit of citrus and mild bitterness in the hops. Fairly clean after with a bit of yeast astringency.

Bottle @ home. Pours a touch hazy golden appearance with a smallish white head. Soft, light banana, lemon, a bit zesty, vanilla wafer aroma. Kind of dry grainy wheat, tangy, lemon, a touch bland flavor. Not hard to drink but nothing special.

Bottle. Hazy gold, thin but lasting white head and good condition. Lemony citrus initially in the nose with a slight sweet yeastiness, muted fruity citrus in the mouth with some sweetness and a slight chalkiness developing, low fruity finish.

12oz bottle.  Small white head atop lightly hazed straw body.  Aroma is medium sweet, orange, some bubblegum, wheat, bread.  Taste is moderately sweet, orange/lemon, wheat, some bubblegum, light seltzer, bread.  Light body, some effervescence.

Easy clean white heads sits on the foggy off golden body. body itself is fairly fuzzy at the start leading to some somewhat cutting burping. Don’t get anything smooth in that respect from my body. A very soft touch of spiciness with some soft faded citric traces and a hint of dough. A training beer for the craft curious/skeptic.

Bottle from Tesco 131112

Pale yellow, fairly hazy, frothy white head, some lacing

Aroma - light citrus zest, lemon hop, touch of cereal, not much else here

Taste - light pale sweet malts, soft bit creamy cereal, light peach and apricot, rather dull to be honest

Palate - medium carb, thinnish body, quite creamy texture. Finish - little dry. Finish - rapid, dull

Overall - It’s quite refreshing, but its a dull beer with almost no finish. Disappointing.

Very nice.  Surprising flavours. This is far less sweet and bubblegum than something like Hoegaarden.  312 tastes much more like a beer, it has some bitterness, a deeper malt behind the citrus. Also has lots of very small bubbles so gives a very smooth and velvety experience.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with frothy white head and light lacing. Aroma of wheat and corn malts, not a whole lot else. Taste is all wheat, not a whole lot else. Pretty bland and boring, nothing all that exciting what-so-ever. They need to stick to crazy hoppy beers or stouts.

Tasted from the bottle @Harley, Sheffield, on 04/11/2012.
Pours of hazy straw colour, with a good snowy white head that quickly dissapears.
Aroma is not very intense, having a dominant malty&caramelt sweet character.
Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and high carbonated.
Taste is zesty&acidic upfront, following by herbal, slightly sweet tones.
Aftertaste is intense and very citrusy.
In short, too sweet, to my personal taste.
Neutral.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with average, fizzy white head; short retention and spare lacing.  Aroma is cloves, wheat, bread malt, and floral hops.  Flavor is light malts forward with some wheat, faint floral hops, and light fruit esters; dry finish.  Light body and medium carbonation.

Bottle.  Pours lightly hazy yellow with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing.  Aroma is wheat, coriander, lavender, spicy and citrus hops.  Flavor is malt forward with light hops, bitterness, and spices with a dry finish.  Light body and medium carbonation.
Draft. Somewhat floral aroma. Pretty golden, teeny bit muddied. Easy to drink. Light, crisp but not crackly. A pleasantly delightful surprise.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head that stays for a bit. The aroma is faint at best with a little wheat spice. Taste is light with, little grassiness.
draft, no aroma, no taste, not even a wheat taste.  Don’t waste your time with this one.

Pours clear bright yellow with a creamy medium white head...lively...great lacing.  aroma has very mild wheat and very faint spice.   Flavor is grassy/spicy/wheaty but very subtle and mild.  Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is dry and wheaty/grassy.  Not bad at all...but fairly boring.
Bottle. Hazy light yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma of citrus. Wheaty taste with some yeast and citrus.

Mute nose with a hint of wheaty yeast. Mouth is brighter than I thought. Hop profile is nice. Citrus only though. Finish is clean pilsner like. Ok not the best but fun. 

---That dog will hunt!

Pours golden. Wet dog and yeast aroma, with watered down wheaty flavor. Definitely not Goose Island's top effort.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap at margarittavilley  in navy pier chicago (10/7) This was my first beer after running the Chicago Marathon so was tasty in that aspect. Poured hazy and thick like a hefe. went down smooth with lots of hop with the wheat finish
Bottle 33 cl. Yellow hazy with a small white head. Not much wheat here, more fruits and light spices. Fresh bitter taste with a light wheaty enindg. Tested 08.05.2012
Stanley’s Beer Fest 10/6, BOTTLE. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Slightly sweet.

Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a large foamy white soapy head that dissipates to a film and soapy collar. Aroma has citrus orange and lemon with plenty of malt and slight caramel. Taste is bready citrus orange peel and lemon rind with a yeast malt finish. Palate is thin and chalky dry. Really not that bad pretty enjoyable.
Very slightly hazy gold beer. Crispy palate. Lagerish light malt that turns softer and silky. Subtle hop fruit and bitterness. Finishes dry. Inoffensive but average.
There is almost no taste and the after taste is skunky. It would definitely be a summer beer if I ever drank it again; which I wouldn’t.

Pours a tad hazy, good head, nose of citrus wheat. A bit sweet and fruity, but very easy to drink for and unfiltered wheat. The body is not a thick as you would expect from an unfiltered. One step up from say a Blue Moon.

Had on draft at Ditka’s in Oak Brook Terrace.

A: Pours a hazy straw with a 1 finger pure white head. Decent retention with a little spotty lace, but barely there.

S: Nothing much there. A solid grassy wheat with a little malt.

T: Solid crisp wheat with a little hop at the end mixed with some dry malts.

M: Very crisp and refreshing with a slight oily finish. Leaving a dry grass feeling. Nice carbonation.

O: Decent pale wheat ale. Lacks in nose and nothing much going on with the taste. Definitely refreshing though.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 06-15-2011
Hazy yellow in color... Aroma of wheat, flavor is typical of your average hefeweizen, mostly wheat with minimal notes of hops... Average wheat
Nothing special. An avarage good wheat beer. Had this late at night so my memory is not that good. Have to revisit this one. Drinkable.

Tall glass, cloudy yellow with two fingers of head. Looks really nice.
Banana bread smell, blunt, little bit of lemon.
Watery taste, lemon bitterness. 
A fair amount of carbonation, medium body and crisp.
Looked great, the taste was a letdown, which makes it fairly average for a wheat.
Colour is a bit anaemic, with a rather insipid froth to the head. The typical range of spicy/citrusy flavours with a quite clear, tart finish. Nothing special but certainly pleasurable.
Bottle - lemony smell, a bit spicy, hazy body, white head. Bland taste, but a sweet after kick. Okay I guess.
what is urban wheat?  Not that great apparently.  No prominent features, has a touch of hop blended in with a mild grassy taste, many better brews out there.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; I suppose you have to have a bad beer to appreciate how good beer can be. Like a watered down wheat weak flavour slight spice undercurrent.
Umm it’s there. Tap pour. Nice hazy yellow.no aroma.very light flavor maybe the faintest hint of a suggestion of lemon? Very mild hops and a fast finish. Snore.

Aroma: Rather faint smell, lemonade, some spices, cardamom and yeast.
Appearance: Golden, hazy, a white head leaving little lacing.
Taste: The taste is mostly in the lemon(ade) area, but well complemented with bitter aromas, lemon peel and a faint yeast residue.
Palate: A medium carbonation, refreshing and good bitter finish.
Overall: A nice wheat beer that has some bitterness.
Note: Bottle. Reviewed 2010-04-08.
Aaaand this is the most overrated micro to macro brew of all time. Totally flavorless carbonated swill. Give it as a gift to someone you don’t want to remotely impress.
They hand this beer out after you finish the Chicago Marathon. After running 26.2 miles, I can’t even finish a cup of this. That’s how bad it is.
Pale, watery, light, but with a bit of a creamy mouth feel. Light fruit, a tad bit of spice, and little hops.
330 ml bottle. In general a nicely wheat-characterized late-summer beer, but I think this one tastes a little too sweet.
Pours yellow gold. Got this on the house from the waitress, so this rating is skewed.

Pours slightly blurry gold with a tall, off-white head.
Faint wheat and citrus scent.
Taste is malt and wheat....a little lemon.
Very light and soft.

Light hazy yellow colour with a white head. Wheat and citric aroma. Fresh wheat sweetness with fruity and citric notes. Also some spicy notes. Fresh and easy drinkable.
[Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden]

I had this beer when it first came out and wasn’t a fan.  It was left for me as a welcome gift tonight so I am going to enjoy the gesture and rate this beer while I have the chance.  It’s a 12 ounce bottle with a label that, under the "312" logo reads, "Brewed and Bottled by Goose Island Beer Co. in Baldwinsville, NY".  Now I’m not one of those dorks who is butt hurt that the Hall family achieved the American dream and sold their business to AB...BUT...the label really seems illogical and out of place.  A "312" ale brewed in NY?  Should this be a new entry under a "212" label??  I poured the bottle into a large rocks glass.  It pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a one finger white head that reduces to a marshmallow film but doesn’t completely dissipate.  Aroma of wet hair and skunk weed.  Taste is pretty thin, watery up front followed by a very faint wheat cereal malt.  Light grass hops and a hint of lemon trail behind.  Very thin palate; like water.  Clean finish.

Bottle at home - Apr ’12.
Hazy golden pour with a thin white head.
Little aroma to this beer, faint wheat and grain, a little pale malt.
Taste follows on from the nose with a little citrus and grassiness in there.
Light to medium in body and perhaps a little over carbonated.
No need to re-visit!

33cl bottle @ Monks Cafe Wallingatan, Stockholm. Hazy yellow color, small to med sized white head. Smell malts, herbs, flowers and spices. Taste malts, some wheat, herbs, slightly flowers. Low body, low carbo.

I’ve had some of Goose Island’s higher rated beers and been very disappointed.  Go figure, this one is rated low and I really liked it.  

Straw yellow with thin white head.  Lemon in nose and flavor.  Tingly on tongue.  Nice hops for a wheat ale.  Easy drinking.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a medium size head, good wheaty and fruit aroma, the taste is light sweetness, with dry watery finish.

12oz bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was lemon, banana notes, wheat character. Bready malts, wheat notes. A pretty refreshing one on a hot day (it was like 95 degrees).
Very nice wheat for the non-wheat crowd. Nicely balanced across the board. Pretty light.
While I my be biased because Im from chicago I love 312. My favorite wheat. Only wheat that stacks up is gumball head.
Bottle. Color yellow with medium white head. Aroma malt, wheat, hop. Taste sweet, malt, wheat, orange.

I actually didn’t mind this one, coming from someone who isn’t a wheat fan. Hazed light yellow pour with a full almost two finger head. Aroma is light citrus, lemon peel... Kinda that’s it. Flavor is crisp citrus, grainy wheat (but light), little to no hop, smooth and clean. Light lacing... I’d like more hop, but it wasn’t bad.
Yellow color.   Weak carbonation.  Small head.   Strong flavor, but not pleasant.  Fruity aroma, but stale taste. Not impressed...on tap at Dubh limb square, bordentown. Nj.

A: Hazy, light yellow with a thick white head that leaves a fair amount of lacing.

S: Simple, with notes of lemons and wheat.

T: Lemons and wheat with a fizzy gang. Decent, but there are many better wheat beers available. The beer is easy enough to drink, but lacks any really prominent flavors or complexities that would make it much more intriguing and enjoyable.

M: Very highly carbonated. Average feel.

D: An average tasting beer from a terrific brewery.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-02-2010

Very light aroma of malt and some yeast. Taste is dissapointing, there should be more of everything here. It’s taste like a mixture of a industrial lager mixed with 1/3 of a wheat beer. Goose Island usually make better beer.
Cloudy straw with a 3 finger white head. Light aroma of yeast. Lots of carbonation, some orange and lemon zest, overall very light.

Pours a pale, cloudy yellow.  Sweet aroma.  Light white head that settles quickly.  First taste is sweet, citurs...more on the lemon side.  Finishes with a faint not of hops...cleanly.  Usually not a fan of wheat but this one is o.k.
Bottle at bar. Thick yellow, white head. Smooth taste with wheat, citrus. Light finish. Pretty decent brew.

Ar: Lemon and belgian yeast 
Ap: Slightly hazy pale gold - weak fizzy head that quickly diminishes
T: Slightly sour due to lemon, wheat comes through - light and refreshing
P: Lively carbonation and thin body - again, refreshing
O: Nice beer to have on a hot Chicago summer day
On draft at Bar Louie in Bolling Brookk, pours a light cloudy yellow, aromas of wheat, with some light yeasty banana.  Flavors follow suit, light on palate ok wheat beer.
On tap in Long Branch, NJ. Blonde body with slight head. Nose quite hoppy with citrus. Taste is also hoppy, but not so much, and some citrus notes. Pretty watery and bland. Okay.

Bottle - 12oz. Hazy blond body with a thin white foamy head. Thin malty/hoppy aroma with citrusy and yeasty hints. Taste is slightly dominated by hoppy flavors. Ends with a short bitter/herbal finish. Ordinary.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a hazy golden yellow with a small white head.  The nose is on the lighter side, featuring slight grain, yeast, and citrus notes.  The flavor, while not complex, is decent.  There is a little wheat, apricot, and citrus. Light on the palate with a good amount of carbonation and a crisp finish.  This one is meant to be perfect for a hot summer day.
Not a bad beer by any means. Very easy to drink and great on a hot day but not so much if the beer warms up. I would just go for Honkers or any other beer in their line as they have more flavor.

12 oz single from Spirits Brick. Poured a hazy straw yellow with an average sized bubbly white head. Aroma of lemons, wet hay, orange juice and toast. Palate is loaded wth bubly carbonatoin, a medium body and a quick fading aftertaste. Flavor of weak oranges, straw, toast,  hint of lemons. Blah, would rather have a Blue Moon.

On tap in NYC. Pours a light golden yellow, nose is grainy. Not terribly 
flavorful, and very very light, which makes it a thirst quencher and drinkable.
Average at best.
pale, cloudy, light sweetness, apricot tones. Drink cold on a hot day. Enjoyed this very much.
Very clean, crisp with a watery feel. Hint of citrus hops. Very light and refreshing. Good for a summer day.
Bottle to pint.  Looks light and hazy.  Smells doughy and wheaty.  Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Eh.
Spruce, apricot, very light in flavor and body. Almost clear in color, white head lingers.
a very light tasting beer, there is a strong hint of lemon zest, which is the dominate flavor and doesn’t offer not much else. is very clean and partially flavorless. call it refreshing on hot days.
Pale straw yellow with a creamy white head.  Crisp slightly spicy aroma.  Light and refreshing.

The aroma is weak and watery but does have some wheat and citrus hops. The appearance is pale gold with a light haze and a small head. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. Overall a fine session beer but I wanted more from this one.
This beer is wonderfully refreshing with a nice subtle hop notes. Certainly not an intimidating beer.

Pours classic cloudy yellow (unfiltered wheat) with good head and very little lacing.  Aroma is also classic for the style - some spice and lemon with wheatiness.  Flavor is bready malt with a little bite in the finish.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Not much aftertaste.  Standard, average wheat - good for a hot day like this.

Cloudy bright yellow pour with very little head.  Aroma of lemons, wheat, apples, and grass.  Taste is slightly sweet, very crisp, and highly carbonated.  Strong wheat flavor along with subtle lemons and other light fruits.  A good summer wheat beer.

Very much a summer session beer.  Has light piney aroma with lemony notes.  Taste is both citrusy and bready but very light.  Thin in body.  Nice malt flavors in finish.  No much tartness from the wheat.
On draft at Bader Field.  Poured hazy yellow with thin white head.  Yeasty, wheaty.  Some slight estery notes present.  Watery.  Decent on a hot day but that’s about it.
(bottle) Cloudy, pale gold body with a small white head. Pale malt and straw aroma, light spice and yeast. Body is light and bubbly. Pale malt flavor, lemon, a little watery, light bitterness.

From a bottle stamped Bottled on 04/16/12.  The color is a slightly milky pale yellow with a white fizzy head and busy carbonation. The aroma is of pale malts and wheat with a clean, crisp hop note. The body is light. The taste has a slight citrus zing with a clean hop finish. The wheat is more subtle all around.
Very good unfiltered wheat. Idk what the urban implies but full flavored citrus notes. Cloudy yellow pour.
Good overall wheat beer, you can definitely taste the wheat in this beer.  The head is very white, would like a little darker color in the hear. Clarity is hazy like a good wheat should be.

Bottled. Pours hazy and pale golden with an average sized white, foamy head. Nose of grain and a hint of fruit. Sweet flavor with grain, fruity notes, yeast and some light spicyness. Light bodied, watery texture and average carbonation. Ends up more dry.

Poured on tulip. It has a dark lemon appearance  with a small head that disappear quick. The body of this beer also appear dirty and cloudy and it is really bubbly. There is almost no sense of smell in this beer earthy and small hints of lemon. There is almost no taste to this one, its yeasty small hints of citrus not interesting at all. The mouth feel in this beer is also not interesting, very carbonated, light and easy to drink.
Nice fresh malt and light hop aroma. Cloudy light golden color with a large white head. Mild wheat beginning with a moderate fruity sweet finish.

A fresh nose, of very small stature, with tiny hints of spring birch leaves. A bit hazy light yellow colour of the kind you expect from a good Weizen. Well balanced taste but a bit thin almost watery.

On draft in a mug. Hazy gold color without head that promises a good wheat ale. The nose is spicy though, very surprising. The taste again is dominated with the spicy hops, and not all that much fruit. I like it. Just not so much what I expect from a wheat.
Draft. This was enjoyable if not memorable,  Nice, unfiltered look but the taste was a little flat and it came off a tad thin.
I have had this numerous times. I enjoy the unfilterness of this beer, although at times it can get too sweet for me.

19th December 2009
Very slightly hazy gold beer. Crispy palate. Lagerish light malt that turns softer and silky. Subtle hop fruit and bitterness. Finishes dry. Inoffensive but pretty bland.

Rating #48 for 2012

12oz bottle cold, from a stem glass. Aroma musky, gum, some citrus. Hazy yellow almost no head. Taste of lemon zest, slightly sour finish. Palate was clean, high carbonation but still finished smooth.
Grainy wheat nose, a little soapy. Hazy yellow, thin head. Grainy lemony wheat, finishes with unbuttered popcorn. No diacetyl, but corny. Not the best example of the style, but I like it.
Pours yellow gold with thick white head and lacing.  Aromas of grain and hints of lemon.  A little grainy little wheaty, some hints of lemon.  Easy drinker, great for 80 degree days like today.
Tap. Pale clear yellow with dissipating white head. Smells faintly of honey and gives me the impression of pears. Flavor reminds me of Cap’n Crunch cereal. Light bodied.

Smells like fresh cut lemons and wheat. Looks like a lemon too, or at least a neon sign of one anyways. Long, sweet taste that gets bitter but never dry. Light body for easy summer drinking. Not the best of wheat beers.

Pours a hazy yellow with about a finger of white head. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Taste is light sweet. Lots of wheat and a little lemon citrus. Medium bodied with a thin yet sticky texture. Fizzy carbonation and a somewhat longish finish. Overall, not bad. I’d take it over a "lite" beer any day though.

This might be the exact Wheat Ale that Goose Island was hoping for. Something that would appeal to the widest consumer base possible. For those of us that appreciate beers that are out of the box a little, or give us a new experience, this one is not it. Bland bubblegum and grain flavor, palate cleanses the palate to an almost sterile environment.

Poured into a shaker glass from a 12 ounce bottle bottled on 4-24-2012.



A: Clear yet hazy pale yellow body with a decent sized white, sort of soapy looking, head.  Lots of lazy carbonation bubbles float to the top. This looks decent.



S: Mild citrus in the aroma, sort of a bit like urine actually. Thankfully the aroma is very faint. Not a fan.



T: This is pretty meh. Slight lemon tart with mild spice, this is just boring.



M: This feels pretty dead on the tongue, carbonation hits at the end lazily.



O: Not excited about this at all, bland and boring.
hazy golden, two finger head. slight hops and lots of wheaty goodness. nicely balanced. solid, but unexciting.

On tap at a local watering hole. Pours clear straw yellow with a white cap. No lace. Light scents of wheat and lemon. Wheat in the flavor as well as some light hops. Enough flavor to not be boring. Light, somewhat dry palate. This will be a good summer time lawn mower beer.
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours slightly cloudy yellow with a small white head that fades quickly leaving no lacing. Aroma is fruit, malt, wheat. Taste is much like the aroma – body is a bit watery.
Pours gold with a white head.  Aroma is wheat and earthy.  Taste is muted bitters with a sweet finish.  Light mouth feel.

Bottle pours cloudy pale yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of fruit and wheat malt. Taste is slight spice, fruity, and corn. Body is light.
I dont need to taste again.

The Goose is Loose in Connecticut, finally! My salesmen have been taunting me with the Goose Island beers for over a year now, and as of May 1st they’ve finally been released. Just today we received our first shipment which included this little gem, the 312 Urban Wheat Ale.

Despite its appearance in the picture, the 312 pours a light straw shade of yellow, with a bright white one finger foam on top.  As the foam recedes, a small amount of lacing remains.On the nose, the 312 is a light crisp combination of malts, wheat, citrus, and just a touch of soft hops.

The Goose 312 drinks somewhere between a crisp summer ale and a soft American wheat ale.  The body is light and easy drinking, there’s a subtle hint of hops, just a little sweetness, and nice lingering finish.

This is the first time I’ve had the Goose Island 312 Urban Wheat ale, and I’m definitely a fan. Where I come from we do our best to keep the freezer full of geese, but now that Goose Island is available in Connecticut, the hunt is going to be a lot easier.
On tap in a shaker.  Pours golden.  Aroma of wheat, caramel malts, and light hops.  Flavor about the same.  Average texture.  Not the best wheat beer.
12 oz bottle at Lou Mataldis.  Pours bright yellow, slightly hazy.  Slight white head.  Wheaty.  Slightly sweet, yeasty.  Good.
Pours hazy straw color. Some citrus flavors but very mild all around. Some banana aroma.

0,35 bottle. Slightly hazy as a proper wheat beer should be. Pleasant first impression with citrus but a bit bubble gum. Short aftertaste. Too thin really and not worth the extra money, but maybe I’ll buy another bottle just to make sure.

On tap at the Corner Pub.

Appearance - Hazy golden color. Generous foamy white head. Good retention. Decent lacing.

Aroma - Not much on the nose. Just some wheat and grass.

Taste - Clean wheat flavor. Some lemony zest and light grassy hops add a touch of bitterness.

Mouthfeel - Clean & crisp. Dry. Soft carbonation.

Overall - It’s enjoyable. I’d have it again if I were in the mood for a simple wheat beer.
Bottle pours cloudy pale yellow with a thin white head. Aromas of fruit and wheat malt. Taste is slight spice, fruity, and corn. Body is light. Ok for a wheat beer.
There is a hint of citrus to this one that sticks with you for a while. It’s light, but has a bit of a soapy feel that stays around for a while.

Bought at ICA Stakkevollan. 0,33 bottle. This wheat ale pours a hazy straw yellow body with a white fluffy head. Aroma of citrus, banana, tropical fruits, wheat and yeast. Smooth mouthfeel. It has potential but it strikes me as a bit "light" tastewise.

Hint of lemon in the taste, nice and refreshing. Not a bad beer but lacks in character, it tastes too clean and lacking in body for an unfiltered wheat beer. Tastes like a generic supermarket beer with a drop of lemsip.
Pour is a cloudy light yellow with a white head. Nose is rather mild, some light fruit, but mainly dominated by the wheat, taste is very similar.
On draft, pours yellow in color with lit head. Mild aroma, mild  flavor, mild everything about this beer. Just a typical wheat beer. decent session beer but that’s not what it is. Just ok for me.

33cl bottle. Shady yellow color. Small white head. Aroma of grain and citrus. Flavour of wheat, hops and yeast. Chalk is present. Good enough!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours yellow with white head. Smells malty, citrus and some stank. Taste is wheat, citrus and skunky hay. I might have just gotten a bad one since I grabbed it from a dirty corner deli. This was not good though.
From the tap poured an amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice light malty flavor with a quick finish.

First, let me say that I love most wheat ale’s.  This one is a good regular, session beer and tastes great in hot weather.

But in terms of other offerings in this category, a bit on the weaker side.  

It’s got more of a citrus aroma and a yellowish but not cloudy appearance.  It’s fizzy and lemony to me.  Lighter and doesn’t have a great head build up.

Goes down easy.  Better than drinking a Bud or some other crap during the summer.
Very light with a malt aroma. The beer is pale yellow with a white head. The flavor is very light and thin. A bit of hops to balance the sweetness.
A thin wheat beer with little. Weak foamy head. Basic cascade hop. Had on tap, so maybe the lines were not clean, but the beer tasted tinny.I’ll give them the benefit of the doubt.
When you get to a bar and this is the best beer they have, it’s a great beer. But given the opportunity, I would have most other options from Goose Island.
In a can now, its your basic wheat ale.. smooth and easy drinking nothing stands out here and I prefer Oberon to this
An okay wheat ale; it has the wheat ale characteristics that make it refreshing on a hot day, but there are other wheat ales that do the same thing, but taste better.
Bottle in Hotel Room, Chicago. Clear yellow - white head. Citrus. Spicy. Light coriander notes. Wheaty. Light light sweetness. Light bitterness.

On draft poured in taster glass
Aroma:  lemon, grass
Appearance:  Very pale, clear, 1 finger head that faded quickly
Taste:  light sweet, light sour, light bitter
Palate:  slight bitter aftertaste, light and thin, medium carbonation.  crisp
Overall:  very sessionable but also hardly any flavor.  the flavor that is there is appealing
330ml bottle. Pours cloudy/hazy straw yellow - mild citrus nose.  A confusing cross between wheat and pale ale. Crisp finish. OK.

Somewhere between a pale ale and wheat bear. Light, fragrant citrusy. Nice and refreshing from time to time but lacks "punch"; a bit watery. I’d almost certainly give it another go given the opportunity - there’s something there - just probably wouldn’t go too far out of my way to do so.

Bottle
Light golden slightly hazy
Some aromas
Light body & complexity
Ok beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy in the traditional wheat style, with a lot of carbonation that tingles the tongue. Aroma of a little fruit and wheat and yeast, that travels through to the taste. Fruity characteristics last throughout the drink.

12oz bottle 1.5m after bottling...

Appearance: Golden hazy brew with plenty of rising carbonation.

Aroma: Grain, lemony hop, and biscuity malt.

Taste: Light breaded malt and lemony hop notes to balance to a crisp and refreshing beer.

Palate: Crisp and well carbonated. An easy drink, especially at it’s low alcohol content.

Overall: A good beer within it’s category. Strongly recommend Montana Trout Slayer from Big Sky Brewing Co. if you like this style of a beer.

Serving type: bottle
Good wheat beer. Nice aroma and flavor. Wheat flavors come through. Overall good drinker. would have again.

On tap.
Hazy yellow pour with a decent white head.  Nose of citrus and wheat.  Easy drinking and smooth on the palate.  Very drinkable with a nice mix of citrus and wheat bite.

Long Island, NY - 12 oz. bottle poured a hazy blonde color with good head and lacing. Aroma was sweet, malty but light. Taste was similar, this was a crisp, fresh wheat ale. Good summer brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not bad, but hardly a standout among wheats and not up to the standard of a lot of other GI beers.  Nose is the highlight, featuring a nice citrus note, probably from the hops, in addition to the expected wheaty notes.  Flavor falls off a bit, lacking the hops character of the nose and fading quickly from the palate.

12 oz beer pours yellow with a white head.  Aroma is citrus, yeast and malts.  Taste is citrus and yeasts.  Nice summer beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap poured into standard pint glass

a: very light pale yellow color, clear no haze what so ever, foamy 1/2" head with good retention

s: clean, slight lemon

t: clean, slightly sweet, nice citrus profile, slight hop flavor. Crisp

m&d: light body,
Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with white head.Aroma of spices and cirtus,mild yeast flavor and fresh,summer like type of a good wheat beer with all that matters.
As one who grew up in the 312, back when the 312 was not just Chicago, I really enjoy this brew.  A nice chrisp and easy drinking wheat ale. Especially great on a summer day.

Embodied with wheat/barley malts and spicy hops, this wheat ale is a refreshing balance of citrus and spice flavors. It has a billowing, resonating flavor. Carbonation is mellowed, allowing for the smooth unfiltered texture one would expect. One of my all time favorites.
Pours yellowish...arouma of orange...I likez it.... Nice grassy wheat flavor... Nice crisp finish..

From notes.  First reviewed 4/12/2010.  Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

Moderately hazy pale golden color, with a small head that exhibits some retention and leaves lazy stick along the glass.

Mostly wheat in the aroma; some floral and lemony citrus hops.

312 has a clean, bready flavor with faint pervading yeast. Slight sweetness before lemon hops give it a little bite. Clean and smooth.  

Medium carbonation, but does not "pop" or have a particularly noteworthy feel.

312 is relaxing and easy to drink. This beer makes me think about sitting outside in a Chicago beer garden and having a few over the summer. Simple and easy to drink.
Bottle. Yellow white a white fluffy head. Fizzy. Light wheaty flavour with a hint of spice. An easy going beer best suited to summer sessions.
Great summer beer, nothing special.  Clean, crisp, lacking the yeast character I really like in wheat beers.
Goose island doesn’t make bad beers. Not my favorite style but super tasty. Enjoy it a lot.

@ ORD.  Hazy light tan.  Low but fluffy head. Spicy-yeasty aroma with light fruitiness.  Full-bodied for a wheat ale with spice, yeast and lots of clean pale malt. Only a light yeast character but for an introductory beer this is pretty good.

My wife brought this one back from a trip to Rochester. Fairly disappointing given my fondness for wheat beers. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy pale yellow color with a small creamy white head. The aroma was tart, citric and  a bit lactic. The flavor was dryish and a bit wheaty with notes of tart citrus and bread. Medium length tart citrus and bread finish. Light body. Eh.

Draft - pours murky light neon yellow with light white head and some lacing. Nose is wheat and lemon. Aroma is lemon peel and citrus hops. Taste is bitter and mildly sweet. Light body and thin texture. A good summertime drink.

A - pours hazy light straw yellow with short white head. 

S - aromas of funk and fresh dough. Light citrus as well. 

M - ultra light body with lively carb. Lingering yeast funk ending. 

T - wheat, yeast, funk on the nose, weak citrus on the palate. 

O - very weak light beer. Not my cup of tea. 

4-

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours pale hazy yellow with a white head. Fruity aroma with more hops than expected. Quite different from German Weißbier, and the wheat is not so noticable. Less sweet and more hoppy. Slightly sour with some citrus aromas. Refreshing and easy to drink, but a bit watery and slightly boring.
Clean. Little hope aroma . Very clean cascade pulls through nicely. Great beer for macro lovers

Pours a clear golden with a finger of foamy head. Reminds me of mass produced canadian lagers. Not a lot going on here. Some grassy and floral notes on the nose...very faint though. Some hops on the palate...a bit of citrus as well...but nothing to really get excited about.

Bottle (355ml from Peckhams, Glasgow):

Wheat upfront along with a little yeast and some hints of lemon. There is a very mild, background skunk aroma and some grassy hops as well. I can detect some grain and it is rounded off with light citrus notes.


Cloudy, lemon yellow colour topped off with a pinky-width, foamy white head that settles to a thick looking lacing after a minute.


A lager hops taste to this one to begin with, along with hints of lemon and citrus and a faint taste of wheat. The finish is a dry one and there is almost no lingering after taste.


Medium and smooth with a solid, filling mouthfeel and a very dry finish.



An okay beer that I finished quite quickly and found fairly easy to drink without being overly enjoyable. It’s not a beer I’d seek out again but it was drinkable and something different.



1001 Beers To Try Blog:
Great taste, not overwhelming with fruitiness, and good enough so that you do not get sick of it throughout the night>

(Bottled, rated 2011-05-13) Hazy pale golden with a small, quite firm head. Sourish, dry and lemon-grassy nose with pale malt and wheat. Sour, dryish-wheaty flavor with grassy hops, but also malt sweetness. Not quite medium body, but decent for the ABV. Medium, soft CO2. A decent summer beer, with surprisingly strong sourness. Not memorable, though, and with a hefty price tag.
A very drinkable wheat beer. Not the most complex. The appearance is very good opaque and nontransparent.o

Light lemon aroma. Light haze with bright yellow color. Foams to a one finger that settles to thick but thin head.Lots of bubble action can be seen. Mild zesty lemon softened with a hint of bread flavor. Some sourness but you have to pay attention to notice. Refreshing and zesty feel to it but balanced with a soft finish. Superb for this style.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a dense white head. Aroma is wheat and citrus predominantly. Flavor is both grassy/earthy/wheat-like as well as being light/crisp/pine-y. It falls somewhere between a pale ale and a wheat beer if you ask me. Not bad; could several at a bar if there’s not much else on the menu worth drinking.

Pint on tap at O’Hare airport. Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head.  Aromas of orange lemon and a bit of wheat and straw.  Flavor is very clean wheat with some lingering citrus.  Body is light with a dry feel.  Finish leaves the usual wheat flavor behind
Flaske 0,355l fra ICA Stakkevollan. Veldig lysebrun. Nærmest gul. Litt uklar. Høyt luftig skum. God ferskenaroma. Smaken ganske vassen. Litt fersken. Svakt syrlig & litt søt ettersmak. På det jevne.

A hazy, pale colored body with a bubbly med-dissapearing lacy white head. Light malty with lemon and starch nose.  Medium-light body. Medium carbonation. Soft malt start with bread and wheat that moves to a easy thin water center with some honey. Fruit,citrus, and low hop bitterness. Dry wheat aftertaste  Easy on the mouth.
Hzy pale golden with a white head - aroma has some wheat malt notes and some hints of citrus/spice - thin wheat malt body, not much bitterness - a little thin but still ok

Bottle. Pale, clear lemon water with a thin white head. Very light nose. Flavour is watery wheat. Not bold. Orangey. A bit like a non belgianised Wit. Very refreshing. I’d happily drink a few more. Good session ale by my reckoning.

Pours a slightly hazy, pale golden yellow color with a thin fizzy white head that immediately fades. Minimal lacing. 

Slightly spicy aroma with lemon zest and citrus fruit as well as some bready yeast, clove and banana. Kind of bland. 

Medium bodied with some soft carbonation up front along with some bready yeast, citrus fruit and zesty spice. Crisp with hints of lemon zest and citrus ring along with zesty clove and banana. 

Overall this is a bland, boring beer with subtle flavors that are typical of the style.

Had this one at the Chicago Airport waiting for a connecting flight. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a white head with minimal lacing. The nose is sweet with honey notes mixed with the grain malt. The taste is pretty much the same as the scent. Overall, a decent refreshing wheat ale. Just not worth the $9 at the airport bar.
Bottle at Monks Café Sveavägen Stockholm. Golden colour with white head. Mild citric aroma. Light taste.
Pours a cloudy light white yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is sweet candy wheat.  Taste is light and refreshing.  Sweet with wheat characters and fairly hoppy.  Nice session beer.

355 ml bottle in Germany smuggled in by Travlr and many thanks. Pours a Hazy yellow with an almost too perfect looking white head.  Aroma is orange, wheat and malt. Taste is good spicy citrus at first, then sours. A watery weak palate. Beer lacks character and depth.

Light yellow beer with a almost medium and white head. Aroma is quite interesting, fruits, apricots, sweetness, some honey and lemon. Taste is quite light, fruitness, lemon, dryer than aroma, lager like maltyness in the aftertaste. Light to drink, but still nice. Light and easy beer with nice personality, still overally slightly insipid.
Pours cludy lemon yellow. Light musky aroma. Palate is light-medium with wheat and a slight lemon flavor. Musky. Just ok.

Tasted from bottle into standard pint glass. Poured an opaque yellow color with yeast haze and creamy off-white foam which dissipated fairly quickly, little lace. Aromas of grass, grain, whole-wheat bread, grapefruity hops (which is the wrong kind of citrus for this style, in my opinion), some pepper and clove yeast esters. Flavors of mild malt, slight hops bitterness. Mellow, mushy mouthfeel of wheat. Another trendy Americanized interpretation of hefeweizen. It’s fine, but not great.
grass, sweet fruit and elderberry,pale yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, nice elderberry finish.
Yellow and hazy. Has a white head, mostly diminishing. Sweet aroma, fruity, light yeasty too, not much wheat. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acid too. Creamy texture and soft carbonation.
pale, hazy, minimal head, white foam, Ginherbs, light sweetness, light body, oily feel, average carbonation,
pale, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, Pine, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, bitter, average carbonation, medium body,
I enjoyed this beer. It had a nice amount of bitterness and a good flavor. Looking to find out more about the Goose Island beers.
Pours a dirty golden color with a tiny bit of head. Smells are rich of wet hay. Taste is a medium wheat/barley taste. Not a bad aftertaste. An okay beer.
I had one of these after finishing a long run.  It was refreshing, and yes, a little watery.  Still, it was tasty and if you’re going to choose a post-exercise watery beer, this is a good one.
Aroma is a sweet citrus and wheat. Taste is some bland wheat. Overall I was a little disappointed and bored.
Pretty typical light tasting wheat beer.  Mild tastes of citrus, straw, honey and sunshine.  Decent beer to sip on the deck during summertime.
Tap - nice think head, lots of carbonation bubbles, medium straw color, light refreshing flavor

Video review at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TGbNAY65Hv8




Appearance: Unfiltered hazy straw, 1-finger head sticks around, average lacing



Smell: Wheat, orange, citrus, faint notes of orange juice, banana, uncooked dough



Taste: Medium body, meyer lemon, banana & ripe granny-smith apple, crisp grapefruit on finish, hint of cloves, high carbonation, drinkable



Pairings: Tilapia, lobster, lemon bars
Light sweetness, and a little bit of bitterness. Little taste and aroma to detect at all, I had expected more. Colour is somewhat yellow, it pours a small white head. (355 ml bottle)

Hazy yellow with some floaties. Minimal head. Aroma is citrus, grass, fruity, banana. Highly carbonated, creamy mouth feel. Flavor is citrus, herbal, slightly sweet. Finish is crisp, smooth, and surprisingly long, with lingering wheat and lemon flavors. Average.

poured a boring almost clear piss yellow color with some lacing. Nose of dough, bread, and citrus. Non complex taste with basic notes of lemon peel and a slight floral/hay finish. Overall it’s as average as can be. There are plenty of waaayy better wheat ales out there to enjoy

This is a slightly above average beer. It is widely available and is a simple example of the style. Not something I would go out of my way to get, but it can be found in my fridge from time to time, and I would not be ashamed to include as an extra.

Appearance:  hazy light gold, medium fizzy white head, minimal lace.   Aroma: 	lemon, wheat thins, grass and starch.   Taste:	crackery, grainy, with a little bit of lemon zest.   Finish:  short, crisp, and slightly bitter.   Notes: 	Not a bad wheat ale, and the palate is very nice and drinkable.  The flavors are just average.  If there’s a Hoegaarden available, grab that instead.
Pours a hazy golden yellow, with hints of citrus (lemon), and spice in both the aroma and taste. A good summer ale.

Glass, 5-ounce, on the premise, savoured on July 5 2011; eye: yellowish, opalescent, no effervescence, tiny ring of white head, average lacing; nose: malt, mash; mouth: malt, mash, finale in malt with presence of mash, medium body, not much carbonation, lightly sweet, thin, watery; overall: disappointing

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, 5 onces, à la brasserie, savourée le 5 juillet 2011; œil : jaunâtre, opalescente, pas d’effervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc, dentelle moyenne; nez : malt, maische; bouche : malt, maische, finale en malt avec présence de maische, corps moyen, peu carbonatée, légèrement sucrée, mince, aqueuse; en résumé : décevante

Poured from a bottle into a white cup from a hotel in Sioux Falls, S.D. I know, pretty ideal conditions. (Note: later had it out of the bottle and am adjusted the ratings (not the reviews)). Color was a cloudy yellow gold. Plenty of head, probably because of the cup. The lacing lasted throughout the cup portion.

Smell was predominately wheat and grainy. Some hops, but a bit weak all the way around. 

Initial taste was wheat, second was pumpkin seeds. Some grass, wheat and citrus round it out, but nothing too special. 

Surprisingly refreshing, but really just okay on the feel. Mid-to-high carbonation.

Just an okay beer overall. I wouldn’t try it again unless I was in the Chicago area. I’ve heard the IPA is better, so I’ll have to take a look.

Bottle from Uttobeer, London. Pours very pale yellow, hazy with thin white head. Nose is delightful. Fragrant lemon zest, fresh lemons and touch of grain malt. Taste is very very light and watery. Not complex at all. Very simple. However, it is quite delicate on the palate. Not a bad summer beer and an excellent alternative to lager. I quite like this.
355ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy gold with no head.  Aroma is some coriander hops.  Taste has coriander throughout with some lemon on the finish.  Some lime as well.
This beer is really pretty decent, but still nothing much to it.  I like some more complexity.

On tap at cleveland airport. Aroma is unidentifiable spices.  Fizzy, fruity with light malt and some off flavor bread and yeast.  Odd combinations and not so enjoyable.  Over carbonated. Bad choice for last call stuck in cleveland airport.

12 oz bottle at my sisters house. I thought that this was a totally bland, tasteless and meaningless beer. A good choice for bud to take over production. Thin and watery palate, no real nose, no taste except some light lemon, no hops, no finish; this is one for the craft hall of shame. I will make it a point to re-rate this again someday and hoppe for the better.
Bottle. Not a bad wheat bear. Orange colour. Some carbonation. Sweet and wheaty, but not a lot of flavour.
Slightly cloudy wheat beer with a sweet finish.  Definitely like the Goose Island brewery.

22 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white head that dissipates quickly. Thin aroma, faint yeast. Thin body, average wheat taste. Overall, not a bad beer, good for a hot day, but there are better ones out there.

Bottle.
Hazy yellow with a medium white head.

Aroma is first very candyish sweet with hops just to dry out and get more citrusy with wheat, some honey, banana, soap and hops.

Taste is slightly sweet with wheat, citrus peel, banana. Watery. Soft carbonation.

A watery boring try on a witbier. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at GBBF 2011, honey and a little hops on the nose, plus a hint of cloves and banana, sweetish malt on the tongue then bready and spice notes with hints of lemon, all followed by a lightly hoppy and spiced aftertaste. Well made and refreshing, and a very decent example of the style, although it doesn?t really stand out from the crowd.

On tap at GI Clybourne. Aroma: Lots of honey, some grain, light wheaty caracter. Appearance: Pale yellow, clear, white head. Taste: Light flavor of honey and bread. Palate: Light bodied, med-low carb. Could be more lively. Overall: Tasty summer beer nonetheless.

Cerveza de trigo sin filtrar,bien balanceada,turbia,refrescante!trigo malteado-nada especial!
Cerveza comercial en chicago
355ml Bottle (Shared by FatPhil) - Hazy golden in colour. Spicy and slightly soapy aroma with a hint of loemon. Lemon,spice and soap features in the rather thin and watery taste.

Kirkas ja vaalean keltainen Goose Island -panimon Urban Wheat Ale muodostaa melko nopeasti katoavan valkoisen vaahdon. Sen tuoksussa on sitrusta, persikkaa, simaa ja happamuutta. Maussa on oikeastaan vain sitrusta ja vehnää. Olut on hyvin kesään sopivan keveä, mutta hieman liiankin vetinen. Lipuu rennosti kurkusta alas ja jättää raikkaan tunteen. Ainakin itseäni tämä simamainen elementti viehättää. Hintalappu on sen verran painava, että jätän tämän kuitenkin vastaisuudessa hyllyyn.

330ml bottle (K Market, Helsinki)

5 Flowery perfumy almost soapy aroma.

2 Pale gold, brief fizzy head.

5 Watery and minerally. Touch mashy and raw.

3 Watery palate, fizzy carbonation, some carbonic acidity too. Finish does at least have some graininess, and reasonably bold fruity hops.

10 Pluses and minuses, but pretty dull all in all.
Pours a very vivid yellow color with a white fluffy head.  Smells slightly of wheat and yeast,  Little bit of skunk in the aroma.  Taste is yeasty.  Has some slight bitterness.  Okay.

35.5cl bottle from the local supermarket. Best before 2011-12-08. It poured a very pale yellow colour, bordering on transparent, with a huge white foamy head. Some carbonation. Aroma is laden with wheat as one would expect, but there’s also some spices and hops here as well. Rather refreshing compared the the regular wheat beers I’ve tried so far. Flavour is however a bit thin and lacking texture. Wheat is present of course, but the Cascade hops also is noticable as well as some citrus which is a bit of a suprise. I was hoping for a bit more flavour, but I guess one can’t expect too much from 4.2 ABV. It is however a very nice thirst quencher for the warm summer days.

pours yellow with a slight haze and a very thin white head with no lacing.  a dull lemony aroma.  body is on the thin side but not watery.  taste is lemon with a hint of pepper and a modest hop character.  finish is subtly bitter.  refreshing overall but nothing extraordinary.
A very impressive brew nice color nice head very refreshing for a hot day in ohio
Wheat and grain on the nose.  Clean orange & citrus in taste.  Ends with a nice bread-like finish.  Super refreshing and easy drinking.
this is just an ok wheat.  hazy color, very easy to drink.  Not a favorite by any means
Hazy, pale yellow with a strong white foam. Fruity with a hint of spices. Malt, citrus and some spice. medium to light body with dry finish.

Date: Summer 2010 Mode: Bottle Source: Lakeville Liquor, Lakeville, MN Appearance: Translucent cloudy yellow with thin head Aroma: Citrus and wheat Flavor: Consistent with aroma and light Other: Average wheat beer that I would be okay with not having again. Had it again in Chicago September 6, 2012 and liked it much better.  Had some decent lacing and aroma/taste were better than the 5s I initially gave.  Bumped overall up to a 12 and got to a 3.0 versus the 2.6 previous.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of light orange/orange peel with a touch of wheat.  It pours a slightly hazy orange tinted yellow with lots of fine sediment and a small white head that quickly fades to a thin film.  The flavor starts with orange with a touch of lemon.  The finish has just a touch of orange peel and wheat.  Light bodied with light-mild carbonation.  Overall, a decent thirst quencher/lawn mower beer.

Bottle from State Line Liquors in Elkton, MD. Pours a hazy straw with a medium white head. Aroma of cut grass with a little citrus. Yeast takes center stage at first sip followed by slightly sour citrus and very lightly toasted malt. Very thin body and a short but crisp finish. Glad I had a chance to try it because we don’t get GI brews out here but I won’t be looking for this one again (especially in the AB/InBev era).

Slightly hazy straw color with a wispy white head. Bready malt aroma and big spicy and citrus hop aroma. Light-bodied, creamy mouthful, lifted off the tongue with medium carbonation. Lightly sweet with malt, a touch of hop flavor, finishing dry and enough bitterness to balance. A superb wheat ale. Crisp and refreshing. Perfect for summer.

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow, practically no head. Fruity aroma with some apricots. Fruity flavor as well, with some spiciness, and a malty finish with hints of grapefruit and citrus. There’s a slightly sour taste going on. Easy to drink and quite pleasant.

Two 355ml bottles, 4.4% abv, bought at an ICA store in Tromsø and shared with friends. Filmy layer, spotty lacing, unclear golden body. Fresh fruity wheat to the nose. Fresh citrus fruits in flavour along with wheat and lighter notes of spices. Soft bittersweet ending. Refreshing (Sommarøy, 25.06.2011).

Wow I cannot believe I haven’t rated this yet, seeing as its probably the beer I drink more than any others since its always cheap on tap. Very great wheat, which gives way to floral and sweet fruit with an excellent finish.

Pours from bottle a slightly murky light-yellow.  Aroma is somewhat tart grassy hops and straw with a bit of malt.  Flavor is lightly malty sweet caramel, tart grass, and something like cereal.  Overall, ok cold on a hot day, but not something I would choose to drink often.
Bottle. Pours hazy straw coloured with a small white head. Citrus and herbs in the aroma. Taste is fresh dry with some spicy and sweet elements, citrus and wheat. Medium bodied. Ends dry, quite good.

Pours a hazy pineapple color without much head. Aroma has hints of pineapple denuded of sweetness. Not a lot of flavor on the tongue. Finishes clean. Slightly better than shock top, not as good as blue moon.
Poured from bottle to a snifter glass. Typical wheat beer, citrus aroma with slight hints of banana. Not overly sweet and easy to drink, but nothing too exciting.

Pours a slightly hazy light yellow colour. The nose is largely of wheat with some berries also. Thin although a little creamy with lots of wheat flavour and caramel, some co2 prickle. Quite drinkable but not amazing
Pours slightly hazy yellow with a low head. Aroma is wheat, malts and some citrus. Flavor is pretty much the same. Good for a hot summer day, but otherwise a bit disappointing.

Many thanks to LibrarianGirl’s buddy, Laurie, for bringing this brew back from a road trip to Chicago. Bottled on: 05/16/11. 

Appearance: Pours a hazed, pale straw-colored body with an airy, white head that collapses at a moderate pace.

Smell: Light malty notes, a light kiss of sweet lemon, and a faint, faint hint of underlying graininess.

Taste: Begins with a gentle maltiness of delicately malted barley and wheat. Lightly sweet with a hint of honey water. A noted fruity, faintly tart citrusy hop presence. Low bitterness. Small shred of yeastiness. Drying on the lively, wheat-flavored finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation. Fairly soft mouthfeel.

Overall: It’s an APWA alright, though thankfully not as cheerless and lifeless as some, and, after going out rowing for the afternoon, it really provides for some substantial refreshment.

12oz bottle from State Line. I probably had a bunch of these when I lived in the midwest but I remember nothing of it. Drinking this beer, that’s no surprise since it’s - uncharacteristic for this brewery - quite bland and BMC-ish. Hazy pale gold pour, with a crisp carbonation and a decently lingering head. Nose is initially fragrant, with earthy yeast and a bit of fruit, but also with something soapy in there. Body gets watery too quickly. Taste is about average, nothing really to merit some of the savaging this beer has received but anonymous all the way.
Bottle. Golden yellow colour with a small white head. Wheaty aroma with some malt and citrus. Flavour is wheat, malt, citrus and grain. Refreshing light-bodied brew.

Shared 0,33 l bottle at Cardinal 25-05-2011. Hazy yellow-golden with an off-white, frothy, two fingers thick head leaving excellent lacing. Honey, malty, light smoky, light hickory, light grassy, light earthy on the nose. Sweet, light acidic flavors with malty ant wooden overtones. Light to medium body. Worked well with nachos and hot salsa, and would probably work well with barbecue.
Pours cloudy, pale yellow. Lots of white head. Smell like pineapple and almost like cider. Good, sweet. Cider, hop and pineapple aroma. A tad to sweet to be balanced.

Nice beer with colour reminding of desert sands or even camel of long journey. It has refreshing taste after long day of work in field. Sweet flavor like glorious golden mounds of beaut lady on movie screen. I am recomend this to friends and serve during festival party of many.

355 ml bottle. Rated @ 23.5.2011.

Pours a light yellow colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and some grass. FLavour of wheat, grass, honey, citrus and hay. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a dry, wheaty, citrusy finish. All in all a summery brew without new tricks.
Bottle. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, wheat, hop. Flavour is citrus, wheat, hop, grain, malt. Medium to thin body. Could be more.

355ml bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi



Pours light yellow with a hazy head. Aroma has hints of citrus and spices. Taste is very light with notes of cascade and fruits. Refreshing, very easy to drink but not much taste in it.

Bottle. A gift from a generous friend. Pours hazy yellow, thick, though not terribly persistent white head, lovely lacing. Nose is bright lemon, wheat, spice, very clean, which is somewhat disappointing. Flavours of lemon candies, wheat, coriander. Very tasty, and extremely refreshing, I just find myself wishing for a bit more complexity, especially on the nose.

Bottle from local store. BB 03/12. Poured pale yellow with a frothy head. Aroma is wheat and weak spicy notes. Flavor is malt and wheat, some spicy notes as well. Refreshing, but thin, not very exciting.
On tap. It’s an okay wheat beer, nothing special here. Not much hops or malt but still refreshing. =)

Tap @ Star Bar. Clear (?), light gold pour with a fine white head leaving coarse lace. Fruity, wet straw nose with a hint of cotton candy. Medium body with a faint lemon zest, hazelnuts and typical wheat malts. There is a sweetness which reminds me vaguely of arrested-fermentation NA beers. Perhaps this accounts for the heavier-than-expected body? Not a fan, but paired OK with my excellect Star Burger.

Bottled 330ml (Black Door, BB 03/2012)

Hazy pale yellow color, good creamy white head. Sweet lemon candy aroma. Light body, crisp carbonation. Fruity, citrus-sweety flavor, light acidity. Hints of watermelon. Some kind of artifical notes here too, from spices? Quite simple wheat ale, which works probably best with food.

Apr 27, tap @ Goose Island, Clyborn. Pours clear golden with shortlived white head.  Weak wheaty, malty and hoppy hat aroma. Flavor is acidy, fruity, wheaty, slightly yeasty and has thin body. Finishes shortlived fruity and bitter.

Bottle (355ml) from ICA, Oslo. ABV 4.4%. Hazy, pale yellow colour. Huge white head, reduces rapidly, but stabilizes as a thick bubbly film with a bit of lacing. Aroma is like a mix of light pilsner and weak witbier; haylike hops with a hint of citrus fruitiness. Mouthfeel is light, but filling, very refreshing without being excessively watery. Taste has OK balance. Aftertaste is weak - hint of malt, hop bitterness and citrus acidity.

"The first thing you notice is the hazy, cloudy appearance." Ehm, no. The first thing I notice is the completely clear and very pale yellow appearance. Alright, to be fair with the geese, some sediments were whirled up when I poured the second glass. The white head is huge, as it should be, and although it shrinks considerably in size it never completely disappears, and the foam laces the glass very well. Nice aroma with the usual yeast, spices and faint banana, but the dominating aroma is citrus. The taste is light sweet with a light bitter finish. For a moment I thought there were some sourness as well, but I think it’s just the citrus flavour. The body is quite light with a thin and dry texture. Crisp and refreshing, but not the most exciting beer I’ve had.


[35.5 cl bottle, ICA, Hasle, Oslo]

Pours golden with a thin white head. Aroma has notes of wheat, citrus and a little malt. Flavor is wheat and malt. pretty crisp beer. An alright wheat beer, but nothing special. Doesn’t really have a good body to it.
On draft on Chicago...somewhere. Typical, light but sweet. Very just above average for a wheat. No yeastiness.
Tried this beer at the Casanova Beer Cave Festival (2011), thought it had a nice taste.

Smells of urine and wheat.  Looks almost like lemonade.  Taste is void until the aftermath,which is of wheat.  Not bad.   Very light and smooth mouthfeel, would be a great "lawnmower" beer.  Updated from draft.. Better citrusy aroma then I remember.. A bit fresher
